title: Specialist Information Systems Architect
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.

**Specialist IS Architect**

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be an integral member of the DTI team working on a newly formed Agile Product Team that will own Amgen's Structured Content Authoring and Generative AI solutions supporting the common technical document submission process and their integration with upstream and downstream data sources and systems. The position is located in our offices in Thousand Oaks, CA, or Tampa, FL, or we can also consider remote applicants in a United States. Come join our team and be a part of something new that we can be proud of!

**Role & Responsibilities:**
----------------------------

* Provides design guidance that follows the enterprise architecture vision and adheres to applicable application technology guidelines; mitigates the impact of technical design on security, performance and data privacy
* Plans and develops architectural designs and application solutions
* Resolves technical issues and seeks application rationalization
* Identify and prototype tools and technology, in both an advisory, and in some cases, hands-on capacity
* Leads other engineers by example
* Integrates systems with commercial off-the-shelf applications and custom developed applications
* Migrates existing applications and develops new applications in major cloud platforms
* Communicates effectively with senior leadership
* Interprets and translates goals into technical specifications and drives technological change
* Demonstrates business and domain acumen to interpret and translate architecture plans into business plans
* Collaborates with other architects and developers to provide technical design guidance that aligns with strategy and technical standards
* Evaluates and makes strategic design decisions that address specific technological needs
* Develops and maintains application roadmaps
* Researches and evaluates emerging technologies and novel approaches to make recommendations that enhance business processes and/or create competitive advantages
* Collaborates with multidisciplinary teams to resolve complex technical issues; uses analytical thinking skills to identify, debug and resolve technical issues
* Uses business knowledge and interpersonal skills to build, maintain and influence relationships with senior leaders and suppliers

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek will have these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------

**Doctorate degree**
--------------------


OR


Master’s degree and 3 years of Information Systems experience


OR


Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of Information Systems experience


OR


Associate degree and 10 years of Information Systems

**Or**
------


High school diploma/GED and 12 years of Information Systems experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Familiar with Amgen City Planning platforms like Amazon Web Services, Salesforce, MuleSoft, Databricks, etc.
* Understands established software development lifecycles and methodologies including Agile, iterative and waterfall, using blended resources
* Learns rapidly and continuously takes advantage of new technologies, concepts and business models
* Stays current with emerging technology trends
* Experience with architectural design and application delivery
* Acquainted with Lean IT principles and data-driven approaches
* Familiar with architectural domains including cloud application architecture and container-based deployment
* Excellent analytical and problem solving, communication and presentation skills
* Good understanding of business complexity and project inter-dependencies
* Intellectual curiosity and the ability to question thought partners across disciplines
* Outstanding communication and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations
* Good understanding of basic system engineering, information risk and security guidelines and architecture standards
* Be a great teammate able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now for a career that defies imagination**
--------------------------------------------------


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------


Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Product Architect
description:
**Reports to:** VP Engineering Technology


**Position Overview:**

The Product Architect for Data Operations provides practical, hands-on experience guiding the development of technology using current and emerging strategies, applications, and techniques around our organization’s data.


**Major Areas of Responsibility include:**


* Work closely with our product development team to define data requirements for any new products or enhancements.
* Analyze current systems including performance, size, and velocity of data, and contribute to solution designs.
* Support reporting and analysis directly through the use of business intelligence tools.
* Provide assistance to systems engineering, solutions, and support with respect to how data can be leveraged.
* Organize and lead communication across cross-functional teams.
* Ensure zero missed service level agreement conditions.
* Analytical skills, critical ability and attention to detail.
* High level understanding of business processes.
* Leverage internal and external resources to research service interruptions, vulnerabilities, and intelligence on various updates and enhancements that will improve our operational efficiency. Develop and maintain automated SOPs for maximum availability and security, in coordination with the IT Security team.
* Work with our Enterprise Security, Threat Intelligence and Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) Teams to identify threats, develop or recommend countermeasures to our clients, and perform advanced network and host analysis in the event of a compromise.


**Experience Required:**  

* Experience working on SQL databases; preference for working with data warehouse technologies.
* Experience with major business intelligence tools, such as Tableau or Looker.
* Experience with at least one programming language, such as Python.
* Experience using agile methodologies.
 **Minimum Qualifications (Skills, Knowledge & Abilities):**  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Computer/Software Engineering, or related field
* Experience in a data analyst, product analyst, or product management role
* Knowledge of data security, privacy, and common vulnerability remediation
 **Travel %:** 0 – 10%


**FLSA status: Exempt**


**Additional Abilities Required:**  

* This job operates in both an office and field setting, requiring mobility between locations and the routine use of a computer and other standard office equipment. The ability to lift or move up to 5 pounds, bend, reach, and perform manual tasks may also be required.
 **About The Cannabist Company:**



The Cannabist Company, formerly known as Columbia Care, is one of the largest and most experienced cultivators, manufacturers and providers of cannabis products and related services, with licenses in 16 U.S. jurisdictions. The Company operates 125 facilities including 94 dispensaries and 31 cultivation and manufacturing facilities, including those under development. Columbia Care, now The Cannabist Company, is one of the original multi-state providers of cannabis in the U.S. and now delivers industry-leading products and services to both the medical and adult-use markets. In 2021, the Company launched Cannabist, its retail brand, creating a national dispensary network that leverages proprietary technology platforms. The company offers products spanning flower, edibles, oils and tablets, and manufactures popular brands including Seed & Strain, Triple Seven, Hedy, gLeaf, Classix, Press and Amber.

  

Recognized for it comprehensive benefits, ongoing training opportunities and commitment to diversity and equity inclusion both internally and with external vendors, The Cannabist Company has earned a spot on mg Magazine’s America’s Top Cannabis Industry Employers list.

  

The Cannabist Company provides full-time employees with an excellent benefits and compensation package including but not limited to competitive wages, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, 401K with company match, multiple health plan choices, dental, vision, pet and life insurances, 100% paid short-term disability, optional long-term disability insurance and more!

title: Network Security Architect (Senior)
description:
**Who Is the Grayline Group?**

The Grayline Group is a diverse group of expert practitioners and leaders across disciplines who work together on data driven strategies for our clients, ventures, and partners. We help both public and private sector teams identify and react to shifting technology, market conditions, and the risk landscape with a range of advisory services. Our breadth of experience with emerging technologies also enables us to effectively deliver program management and operational support and services across organizations and institutions managing complex environments. Grayline’s managed security service offering further empowers companies and public entities to adopt a strong cybersecurity posture against the threats endemic to the contemporary technological forces shaping the global economy. Our services enable some of the world’s leaders in public transportation, defense, state and local government, and healthcare to more smartly defend against and more effectively respond to advanced cyber attacks while harnessing information to advance their organization’s goals.

We are a mission-driven company committed to empowering the public sector and associated private enterprises to achieve their goals via a secure cyber infrastructure; this is the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to the highest ethical standards, we empower an open and diverse workplace, and we strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find creative solutions for our clients.

**What Is The Opportunity?**

Grayline is looking for a Blue Teamer and Cyber Defender to design and implement robust network security solutions to protect sensitive data and ensure the network’s integrity and availability as a key part of the cybersecurity strategy team. This role will focus on cloud architecture, security operations applications and platforms, digital signatures, encryption, data and network security standards, and systems security integration. You will review current security infrastructure architecture solutions, guide multi-domain security integration, and develop security guidance as well as communicate recommendations for security enhancements.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Cybersecurity Assessments.** Facilitate a holistic, integrated assessment of the people, processes, and technologies that an organization employs to baseline its current security posture, identify gaps, and create a roadmap to cyber resiliency.
* **Network Security Strategy.** Develop and maintain an organization's network security strategy, aligning it with business goals and compliance requirements.
* **Network Security Design.** Design and implement network security architecture, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, VPNs, and other security technologies.
* **Security Policies and Standards.** Develop and enforce network security policies and standards to ensure consisting security practices across the organization.
* **Risk Assessment.** Conduct risk assessments and vulnerability assessments to identify and mitigate potential security threats and weaknesses.
* **Security Solutions Evaluation.** Research, evaluate, and recommend security solutions, products, and technologies that can enhance the network's security posture.
* **Incident Response.** Develop and maintain incident response plans, and coordinate with incident response teams to react quickly to security incidents or breaches.
* **Security Awareness Training.** Provide security awareness training to employees and ensure that security best practices are followed throughout the organization.
* **Compliance.** Ensure the organization complies with relevant regulatory requirements, such as GDPR, HIPPA, or industry-specific standards.
* **Security Audits.** Conduct security audits and penetration tests to assess the network's security and identify vulnerabilities.
* **Security Documentation.** Create and maintain documentation, including security policies, procedures, and network diagrams.
* **Security Controls.** Implement and maintain security controls, including access control, encryption, and authentication mechanisms.
* **Security Incident Analysis.** Analyze security incidents and breaches to determine the root cause and develop strategies to prevent future occurrences.
* **Security Awareness.** Keep up-to-date with the latest cybersecurity threats and trends and educate the organization about emerging risks.
* **Client Support.** Build rapport and relationships with clients and collect feedback to improve the Grayline Group’s offerings.

**Who You Are**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, computer engineering, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred
* 6-10 years of related experience
* Proven experience in network security architecture, including firewall management, intrusion detection/prevention systems, VPNs, and security protocols.
* Strong knowledge of network and system administration, as well as operating systems and cloud computing
* Familiarity with relevant laws and regulations regarding data privacy and cybersecurity
* Excellent problem-solving skills
* Excellent attention to detail
* Exceptional troubleshooting abilities
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Want to make a difference in a small, exciting company
* Attention to detail, but understands how to meet delivery expectations
* Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism
* Excellent time management to manage workloads with competing priorities
* Security-aware and up-to-date with best practices

**Great to Have**

* CISSP
* CISM
* CISA
* CompTiA Security+
* Certified Ethical Hacker
* CCNA Security
* CCNP Security
* Or other relevant certification

**Where You’ll Work**

* This position is a fully remote position with the exception of client site consultations.

**Where You’ll Go**

* This position requires less than 25% travel to customer and Grayline Group locations in the US.

**Disclaimer**

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

**Grayline Group’s Equal Opportunity Employment Commitment**

The Grayline Group is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The Grayline Group evaluates qualified candidates without regard to any characteristic protected by local legislation. In addition, the Grayline Group provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 10 years
* 11+ years
* 6 years
* 7 years
* 8 years
* 9 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Security Architect - US Remote - PM
description:
VerSprite Staffing is a subsidiary of VerSprite Cybersecurity. Specializing in technology staffing and utilizing a network of technical clients, VerSprite Staffing connects top level technical talent with industry clients through various methods and expands not only clients talent network, but candidates job search as well. At the bottom line, VerSprite adds value to both clients and candidates alike.



We work with clients to fill both full-time and contracting opportunities, so If the following job interests you, please apply to learn more!

**Security Architect**



We are looking for a Security Architect to be responsible for the security design, code review, security testing, and implementation of security capabilities within the core product applications. The Security Architect's responsibilities include reviewing our current security measures, identifying areas of strength and weakness, recommending enhancements, assisting with compliance activities, and responding promptly to security incidents. You will also be responsible for conducting regular system tests and providing recommendations to teams for monitoring the security of their applications.



To be a successful Security Architect, you should be experienced in application security and risk assessment, with a strong understanding of security protocols, authentication and authorization patterns, cloud infrastructure security, and application security, both build time and runtime. You should also possess strong interpersonal and communication skills.


**Security Architect Job Responsibilities:**


* A thorough understanding of the organization's technology and IT systems.
* Planning, researching, and designing secure application architectures and CI/CD pipelines
* Developing, reviewing, and collaborating on the configuration of cloud account configuration, network isolation, security groups, access policies, network policies, VPNs, and overall compute platform security, including both host-based and container-based workloads.
* Integrating identity management systems, digital certificates, and secrets management with application workloads.
* Assessing security capabilities, evaluating tools and approaches, and making recommendations as part of the application security roadmap that is fed into team backlogs
* Reviewing vulnerabilities with teams and suggesting strategies and tactics for remediation.
* Validating security implementations and participating in remediation and risk acceptance efforts.
* Establishing disaster recovery procedures and conducting security breach drills.
* Responding quickly and effectively to all security incidents and providing post-event analyses.
* Guiding the overall security community, cultivating a sense of security awareness, and arranging for continuous education.
* Remaining up to date with the latest trends, standards, and products.


**Security Architect Requirements:**


* A bachelor's or associate's degree in IT, computer science, or equal experience.
* 5-10 years or more of experience in application development and
* Experience with AWS, including EKS, multi-account setups, GuardDuty, KMS, Config, SSM, CloudFront, Firewall Manager, Shield, Network Firewall, WAF, IAM, CloudTrail, Security Hub, Secrets Manager, Inspector, Global Accelerator, ELB, EC2, Athena
* A strong working knowledge of current application and infrastructure risks, secure application design, and operating systems including both Windows and Linux experience
* Excellent teaching, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of C-Sharp, JavaScript, Ruby, NodeJS, Go, Java, Kotlin, Swift, Python, bash, and SQL are

  



This is a 12 month full time contract work,

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Avalon Healthcare Solutions, headquartered in Tampa, Florida, is the world’s first and only Lab Insights company, bringing together our proven Lab Benefit Management solutions, lab science expertise, digitized lab values, and proprietary analytics to help healthcare insurers proactively inform appropriate care, reduce costs, and improve clinical outcomes. Working with health plans across the country, the company covers more than 36 million lives and delivers 7-12% outpatient lab benefit savings. Avalon is pioneering a new era of value-driven care with its Lab Insights Platform that captures, digitizes, and analyzes lab results in real time to provide actionable insights for earlier disease detection, ensuring appropriate treatment protocols, and driving down overall cost.


Studies show that 30% of clinical laboratory testing is unnecessary or overused. Inappropriate testing or missing a key screening can lead to complications and expense arising from unwarranted care, or not obtaining proper care when needed, leading to increased health risks and costs. Avalon helps ensure delivery of the right test, at the right time, and in the right setting. We seek to ensure the most effective patient treatment, improve clinical outcomes, and optimize cost and affordability.


Avalon is a portfolio company of Francisco Partners, a global private equity firm that specializes in investments in technology and *technology-enabled* service companies.


Avalon is a high growth company where every associate has an opportunity to make a difference. You will be part of a team that shapes a new market and business. Most importantly, you will help Avalon to achieve its mission and improve clinical outcomes and health care affordability for the people we serve.


For more information about Avalon, please visit www.avalonhcs.com.


*Avalon Healthcare Solutions is proud to be an equal opportunity employer including disability/veteran. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.*


*Avalon Healthcare Solutions provides and maintains a drug-free workplace for its employees.*


For more about Avalon, please visit our web site at http://www.avalonhcs.com.


**About the DevOps Engineer**:


Avalon’s DevOps Engineer role will assist in the architect, design, implementation, and support tooling and practices that help enable IT engineers to accelerate their productivity in the workplace. Must have a clear understanding of the software development lifecycle and various tooling options to support fully automated continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) solutions to the various scrum teams at Avalon.


*This position is eligible for remote work, but quarterly travel to the corporate office in Tampa, Florida may be required.*


**DevOps Engineer** **- Overview of Main** **Responsibilities:**


* The DevOps role is responsible for identifying opportunities for improvements to continuously drive greater operational excellence. Areas such as, improving elastic horizontal scaling, observability, logging, alerting, container, and application orchestration at scale.
* The DevOps role would drive several site reliability engineering (SRE) principles in helping the scrum teams and the IT Operations teams be successful. The role would also be responsible for driving a post incident management post-mortem process to help review for opportunities to minimize risk and drive continuous self-improvements to our processes and products.
* The DevOps role would be accountable to supporting, partnering, and interacting with the Avalon IT Operations teams, Application Development Scrum Teams, Database, EDI, and Clinical Operations teams.


**DevOps Engineer****- Minimum** **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor of Science (4 year) degree in a technical field such as engineering or computer science, or extensive relevant work experience
* 5 years of experience in an IT Support, System Administration, System Engineering, Software Engineering, or prior DevOps role.
* Proven knowledge of CI/CD, monitoring, alerting, and logging techniques
* Solid knowledge of Linux Administration, Windows, and AWS tooling
* Solid knowledge of enterprise configuration management principles and tooling. Such as Ansible.
* AWS DevOps Certifications a plus.
* Knowledge of containerization technologies. Such as Docker, AWS ECS, AWS Fargate, Kubernetes/ AWS EKS.
* Knowledge of AWS tooling, EC2, S3, CloudFront, etc.
* Strong ability to evaluate, troubleshoot, and solution technical problems for the various IT Teams.
* Ability to excel in a high volume, fast paced environment
* Proven ability to mentor team members
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Passionate interest in IT Network & Security and possess initiative to keep up with current IT trend.
* Enjoys working in a diverse and challenging environment.
* A team player and able to work independently with minimum supervision.
* Ability to work flexible work hours
* Good customer facing skills
* Proficiency in MS Office tools are required.


PM18

title: Infrastructure Architect
description:
My name is Akash Kumar and I am a Staffing Specialist at Tekshapers Inc. I am reaching out to you on an exciting job opportunity with one of our clients.

**Job - Infrastructure Architect**

**Type - Contract** 

**Location - Remote**

**Description –** 

Responsible for Platform Infrastructure Transition and Transformation Management, platform templates and delivery of infrastructure solutions for our enterprise client mission-critical systems. Delivery responsibilities includes management of solution template by platform and also includes infrastructure reference architecture participation, delivery management, implementation scheduling and coordination, financials and contractual support.

We are looking for candidates with a broad background of infrastructure architecture and delivery best practices, including cloud delivery. Resource must demonstrate proven track-record in infrastructure service delivery for business and the ability to learn quickly as technology advances new innovations and offerings enter the market.

**Job Responsibilities -**

* Establishment of Transition and Transformation management processes. Creating/maintaining a reference and standards document
* Establishing Platform templates supporting key dimensions (availability, security, performance, events monitoring, etc…).
* Participation in architecture initiatives, build roadmaps for continuous modernization of Enterprise Application platforms
* Implement infrastructure solutions per reference architecture, contractual and security requirements.
* Ensure that all Infrastructure issues, delays, or client concerns are resolved on a timely basis or escalated to upper management.
* Act as SME between IT Service Provider and Application / Business units
* Standard Operating Procedures for daily interaction with IT implementation partners
* Participate during Incident resolution and RCA
* Subject matter expert for applications, business functions and active liasoning resource between the business community including communications, planning and execution
* Maintain individual expertise by staying abreast of industry trends, reviewing industry publications, emerging trends and compliance
* Help create and maintain disaster recovery processes and technology
* Review/modernize/modify configuration, installation, maintenance, and backup processes for data protection

**Specific Requirements -** 

* 10+ years of overall IT / technical services experience with Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field of Information Technology
* Platform and infrastructure architecture experience – Cloud, Hybrid and Private hosting
* Excellent understanding of ITIL processes, IT systems infrastructure and best practices.
* Project management experience in an infrastructure oriented environment
* Capable of working in a growth oriented environment, with ability to manage and prioritize multiple concurrent requests, projects, and responsibilities
* Proven track record of leveraging vendor and consultant expertise for IT project delivery and support
* Strong analytical, problem solving and judgement skills
* Leadership and Customer facing skills
* Excellent Verbal and Written Communication skills
* Fundamental understanding of the following technology areas:
* Compute and Networking (LAN, WAN, WLAN)
* Storage (SAN) and Backup
* Virtualization (Server and Storage), Public, Hybrid and Private clouds
* Web Technology (Web Servers, Application Servers, Load Balancers)
* Security technology and processes - e.g. firewalls, intrusion prevention, compliance monitoring, vulnerability management
* Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning
* Capacity Planning
* High Availability
* Well versed with Infrastructure financials operations
* High-level understanding of specific technologies:
* Cloud – Microsoft Azure, AWS, GCP or Oracle Cloud
* Cisco UCS
* Microsoft Windows and Linux Operating Systems
* Cisco Network Gear
* EMC/3-PAR
* VMware / Oracle Virtualization
* Veeam / Symantec NetBackup
* Preferred Skillset –
* VCP3/VCP4 certification
* ITIL V3 Certification
* MCSE, CISSP, CISA or CISM is plus.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $60.00 - $70.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* ITIL: 10 years (Preferred)
* Cloud infrastructure: 10 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Endpoint Engineer
description:
The EUT Microsoft MECM Engineer will be responsible for designing, deploying, and maintaining endpoint management solutions using Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (MECM).

Looking for someone that has Architect level experience, but is still in the weeds (code). Really want the candidate to have experience setting up a new Architecture from scratch for over 8k end points and 30+ offices.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* Microsoft Endpoint Manager Administration and engineering.
* Infrastructure management of assets tied into MECM/SCCM.
* Understanding of SQL and MECM/SCCM requirements in a secure government environment.
* Collection and query creation and management.
* Client installation and troubleshooting.
* Application and package creation and deployment.
* Configure, manage, and deploy software updates to required groups.
* Report on software installations and statuses across the networks.
* Maintain Windows 10 and 11 feature upgrades through MECM/SCCM.
* Create custom MECM/SCCM reports.
* PowerShell experience and knowledge.
* Custom OSD task sequence creation, and WIM creation experience.
* Scripting experience to automate task sequences during image deployment.

\\*

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field.
* Minimum of 8 Years of experience as Microsoft MECM Engineer.
* Desired Microsoft Certifications:
* Modern Desktop Administrator Associate.
* Microsoft Endpoint Manager Administrator Associate, or similar certifications.
* Strong technical skills in MECM, including device management, application management, and software updates.
* Experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell.
* Familiarity with Windows 10 deployment, patch management, and system imaging.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving skills.
* Commitment to continuous learning and keeping up to date with the latest MECM technologies and best practices.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $145,000.00 - $165,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 8 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Microsoft MECM Engineer.: 8 years (Required)
* setting up a new Architecture from scratch: 4 years (Required)
* device mgmt, application management, software updates: 6 years (Required)
* scripting languages such as PowerShell.: 5 years (Required)
* Windows 10 deployment, patch management, and system imaging.: 5 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Microsoft Endpoint Manager Administrator Associates (Preferred)

Location:

* Washington, DC (Required)

Security clearance:

* Confidential (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
NewtekOne®, ((NASDAQ: NEWT) Your Business Solutions Company®, is a financial holding company, which along with its bank and non-bank consolidated subsidiaries, provides a wide range of business and financial solutions under the Newtek® brand to the small- and medium-sized business ("SMB") market. Since 1999, Newtek has provided state-of-the-art, cost-efficient products and services and efficient business strategies to SMB relationships across all 50 states to help them grow their sales, control their expenses, and reduce their risk.


Newtek's and its subsidiaries' business and financial solutions include banking (Newtek Bank, N.A.), Business Lending, Electronic Payment Processing, Technology Solutions (Cloud Computing, Data Backup, Storage and Retrieval, IT Consulting), eCommerce, Accounts Receivable Financing & Inventory Financing, Insurance Solutions, Web Services, and Payroll and Benefits Solutions.


Newtek Technology Solutions (NTS) is a key part of NewtekOne. We provide a complete range of IT managed services, secure private cloud hosting, backup and disaster recovery, and full web eCommerce solutions. NTS has specialized in helping businesses leverage technology to drive innovation for over three decades.


Our team has the expertise and experience leveraging a broad range of technology solutions and services that enable your business to operate more efficiently and securely. When working on a project with NTS, clients receive unmatched engagement experience - from concept to execution.


For more than 30 years NTS has been the IT force behind some of the most globally recognized brands. We have tens of thousands of customers across the Americas, EMEA, Asia and Australia. To accommodate the needs of our global clientele, our operations are geographically distributed throughout several missions' critical data center. This vast range allows us to meet almost any applications proximity, common disaster recovery use case, and in-region data residency.


Our advanced proficiencies and partnerships with industry leaders including DellEMC, Microsoft, Citrix, and VMWare, just to name a few, enable companies to communicate and interact securely from work, home, or on the road.


As more and more businesses consider moving key components and other operations to the cloud, NTS is there to make the transition seamless. We support businesses on every step of the journey, from review, to design, to procurement, to installation and implementation, to ongoing support.


We are seeking a Sr. Solutions Architect, to join our Solutions Team. We are looking for a true IT Generalist that is comfortable speaking to and designing solutions for a broad spectrum of technologies ranging from hardware to private cloud. These design solutions include private and public cloud hosting, backup & disaster recovery, consulting/practice management, managed IT services, professional services, and procurement hardware & software sales. You will apply a blend of technical expertise and business intelligence while interacting daily with multiple customers to define, design, and help sell innovative technical solutions that are specially tailored to exceed customer expectations.


**Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
========================================================

* Lead customer discovery and brainstorming calls to gather requirements and perform high level systems and business impact analysis for requested
* Work closely with Sales Executives to accurately identify customer needs and ensure proper solutions are
* Develop and deliver targeted & specific solutions to enterprise executives and decision
* End to End validated best practices solution design leveraging input from multiple sources both internal and
* Creation of detailed Statements of Work that accurately convey all aspects of the solutions implementation and related level of effort
* Solution handoff to internal implementation teams for delivery
* Develop and maintain relationships with key client technical
* Identify, research, and keep apprised of emerging technologies, solutions, strategies, and developments across the technology spectrum with the goal of identifying strategic opportunities for
* Interact with account management, project management, and delivery teams with a focus on continuous process
* Identify and maintain key relationships with vendors/partners while ensuring requirements are met to maintain

**Qualifications include but not limited to:**
==============================================

* High school diploma with equivalent experience and a minimum of 10 years of related experience. Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related technical field preferred.
* Prior working experience of at least 7 years at a managed service provider plus.
* 5 years of experience in architecting, designing, and deploying technical network solutions in a large-scale complex environment.
* Related infrastructure architect and presales skills.
* Desired certifications (any one or more): Azure Fundamentals, AWS Cloud Practitioner, VMWare: VTSP or VTSP for AWS/Azure, ITIL: Version 3 or later.
* Expert level understanding of virtualization, hybrid computing environments, storage technology and cloud native technologies.
* Demonstrates proactive behaviors and self-management techniques, including but not limited to, working efficiently, demonstrating adaptability, and setting goals.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Demonstrates ability to develop new ideas, concepts, and solutions to meet new requirements, unarticulated needs, or existing needs.
* Ability to facilitate workshops with clients and NTS teams to discover requirements, present solutions and obtain client buy-in.


Are you self-motivated and looking for a job where you can be part of a collaborative team that will give you the tools for innovation and growth? If so, come join the growing and talented Systems Support Engineer Team at Newtek Technology Solutions.


The position is remote working from home.


Newtek offers competitive salary and a performance-based bonus program to reward your results. We provide our employees with an excellent comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, supplemental benefits, and a 401(k) savings plan with an employer match. On-going training on technology, sales techniques, industry, and competitive landscape to support your career growth.


Newtek is an Equal Opportunity Employer; M/F/D/V. We require all our employees to perform work in an ethical manner and always uphold our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.

title: Principal SAP Solution Architect
description:
**Principal SAP Solution Architect**


**Company Overview:**  

Argano stands as a leading global digital consultancy, merging strategic insight with execution prowess to catalyze transformation in business operations. Our mission is to boost our clients' agility, profitability, customer engagement, and growth. Through strategic consulting backed by proprietary IP, Argano offers a holistic assessment of business operations, identifying strengths and pinpointing opportunities for improvement. Our worldwide network of industry veterans leads the charge in operational design and technological advancements across various applications, including comprehensive SAP solutions, positioning our clients at the vanguard of digital transformation.


**Role Overview:**  

As the Principal SAP Solution Architect at Argano, you will be the cornerstone of our SAP practice, steering SAP-enabled business transformations. Your mandate is to architect our SAP solution, strategy, delivering unparalleled value through futuristic SAP solutions, and affirming Argano’s status as the definitive partner for SAP digital transformation projects.


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Requirements Management & Analysis:**


* Master the art of requirements management and analysis to significantly advance business objectives.
* Expertly identify and document essential emerging business requirements, challenging business partner preferences to uncover unique value propositions.
* Forge consensus around a future state that resolves business challenges and aligns with enterprise goals, adeptly translating business requirements into SAP solution functionalities.
* Possess a deep comprehension of business process intricacies and the acumen to reveal needs that business partners and end users may not articulate.
* Influence business partner requirements towards enterprise objectives and align with industry domain and standards.


**Creating Compelling Business Cases:**


* Develop and articulate persuasive business cases, quantifying the benefits of proposed projects.
* Maintain awareness of industry-specific trends and their implications for the organization, articulating benefits in a manner that resonates with business leaders.
* Measure the business value contribution of IT projects accurately, swiftly adjusting to shifts in business strategy.
* Support business partners in presenting solution value to key stakeholders effectively.


**Provide Accurate Project Effort Estimates:**


* Precisely quantify project resource needs, adeptly managing ambiguity to produce accurate project effort estimates and communicating risks throughout the lifecycle.
* Actively engage project stakeholders in the estimation process, mindful of the impact of strategic business changes.


**Architecture Management:**


* Champion architectural goals through innovative solution design, identifying commonalities to recommend a cohesive approach across projects when standards are lacking.
* Influence solution options, desired value proposition and decision-making among business partners, pinpointing opportunities for creating reusable enterprise services.
* Navigate technology vendor interactions with an eye towards architectural coherence.


**Business Relationship Management:**


* Foster and enrich relationships with business sponsors, aligning technological solutions with targeted business outcomes and adeptly managing expectations amid scope changes.
* Skillfully mediate conflicts between multiple business partners, prioritizing organizational goals.


**Technical Implementation & Maintenance:**


* Oversee the software development lifecycle for implementing and maintaining SAP solutions, leading small teams and projects from start to finish.
* Architect, develop, test, and deploy SAP application software modifications to meet business needs, consistently adhering to industry best practices.
* Ensure system support aligns with SLAs, resolving issues as they arise.
* Apply enhancements/changes after rigorous QA testing, following standard change control practices to maintain production stability.
* Monitor service changes like upgrades or enhancements to prevent negative impacts on system customizations.
* Oversee interface updates, ensuring accuracy and operational efficiency.


**This position offers a unique opportunity to significantly influence our clients' success and bolster Argano’s growth as a leader in digital consultancy. If you are endowed with profound SAP expertise, a zeal for digital transformation, and a history of impactful achievements, we invite you to join our dynamic team at Argano.**


**Requirements:**


* BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a Business Degree with a strong emphasis on digital technology.
* At least 10+ years of extensive experience in SAP consulting with a thorough understanding of its modules and functionalities, with at least 5 years as an overall solution architect.
* A proven track record of leadership at the executive level.
* Deep knowledge of SAP ecosystems, adept at crafting digital transformation strategies and optimizing business processes.
* Exceptional analytical, communication, and negotiation skills, capable of operating independently in complex environments while fostering a spirit of collaboration.
* Self-motivated, with a proactive approach and hands-on leadership style.


The base compensation range for this position is $170,000 - $200,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave and Flexible Time Off.

title: Power Platform Solutions Architect
description:

This is a unique opportunity to work in the Digital and Emerging Technology space where you'll work with our team to build demo apps for our pre-sale phase with potential clients. title: AWS Cloud Architect (REMOTE)
description:
**Kadiak**
**Job ID 24200044**
**Kadiak, LLC,** a Koniag Government Services company**,** is seeking an AWS Cloud Architect with a Top-Secret Security Clearance to support **Kadiak** and our government customer. **This is a Remote opportunity.**
We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.
Assists other engineers and the Government in requirements engineering, solutions engineering, scheduling, reliability, resiliency, services development, integration, test and evaluation, maintainability, and analysis.
**Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:**
* Participate in technical project review meetings to ensure technical designs meet the client’s operational requirements and infrastructure/security standards.
* Provision and maintain cloud resources for an enterprise cloud environment (network, storage, compute)
* Automate infrastructure migrations to cloud environments and identify on-premises technologies and their cloud counterparts.
* Ensure compliance with incidents, problems, and change management procedures and execute ticket-based requests with little or no additional help.
* Focus on results and be delivery oriented, with a keen interest in quality and the ability to meet deadlines.

**Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**
* Top Secret DoD Clearance Required Must have a valid Driver’s License.
* At least 4 years of progressive experience administering, designing, and engineering cloud solutions.
* Sound fundamental knowledge of cloud technology and enterprise IT systems.
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment.
* Experience deploying resources into and running workloads in Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure
* Ability to clearly translate technical requirements and concepts in a manner that appeals to a wide audience.
* Experience working independently with minimal supervision and guidance.
* Experience with operating systems and software: upgrade planning and implementation.
* Fundamental knowledge of and experience working in a DevOps centric environment
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automation tools, code promotion processes and methodologies.
* Experience with scripting languages such as python, json, YAML or others.
* Experience with deploying infrastructure as code using AWS CloudFormation templates, Azure ARM templates, Chef, Terraform or other automation tools.
* BS degree in Computer Science. Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience

**Preferred, Not required:**
* Amazon Web Services Associate or Professional Level certifications
* Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect, Developer, DevOps Engineer or similar
* Working Knowledge of Systems Administration in Windows and Linux
* Foundational knowledge of AWS Services including but not limited to EC2, RDS, S3, EBS and IAM.
* Working familiarity with Scripting Languages such as Python, PowerShell, and Bash

**Working Environment & Conditions**
This job operates in a professional office environment and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
This position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand, walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The workload may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, do simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress.
The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
**Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy**
The company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information, or any other factor protected by law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment.
The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require accommodation to navigate or to apply for a position on our website, please contact Heaven Wood via e-mail at accommodations@koniag-gs.com or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodation.
Koniag Government Services (KGS) is an Alaska Native Owned corporation supporting the values and traditions of our native communities through an agile employee and corporate culture that delivers Enterprise Solutions, Professional Services and Operational Management to Federal Government Agencies. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Koniag, we apply our proven commercial solutions to a deep knowledge of Defense and Civilian missions to provide forward leaning technical, professional, and operational solutions. KGS enables successful mission outcomes for our customers through solution-oriented business partnerships and a commitment to exceptional service delivery. We ensure long-term success with a continuous improvement approach while balancing the collective interests of our customers, employees, and native communities. For more information, please visit www.koniag-gs.com.
**Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. Shareholder Preference in accordance with Public Law 88-352**

title: Azure Cloud Infrastructure Architect - 100% remote
description:
Cloud AI Infrastructure engineering involves the design, deployment, maintenance, and servicing of Cloud infrastructure underpinning AI and Machine Learning (ML) SaaS implementations for safe and secure construction and deployment of AI services by AI and ML engineers. Rather than building the data models or implementing the AI service, Cloud AI Infrastructure engineering creates safe spaces for AI engineers to build data models which enable ChatBots, AI Search, Machine Learning and similar services which are performant for thousands of users, avoiding data leakage between models and services.

Required Qualifications

· 6+ years of experience in Azure cloud environments.

· Microsoft Azure Certified Solution Architect

· Microsoft Azure Certified AI Fundamentals

· Customer focused with experience leading technical discussions with stakeholders and driving solutions to successful implementations.

· 3+ years of experience using the Azure CLI, PowerShell Az, and ARM templates to deploy, configure, and manage Azure resources.

· Highly experienced in implementing and troubleshooting foundational Azure services (virtual machines, storage, networking, monitoring, databases, etc.).

· Experience generating complex automation supporting systems administration of cloud services

· Familiarity with AI Cloud Concepts

Preferred Qualifications

· At least two Associate-level (or higher) Microsoft Cloud certifications such as Azure Solution Architect, Azure AI Engineer Associated, or Azure Network Engineer

· Team player, confident and enthusiastic; proven partner engagement and cross-team collaboration skills.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to simplify and explain complex ideas.

· Experience writing and maintaining clear and concise technical documentation.

· Expert level knowledge in Azure Core Services.

· Experience implementing Azure Cloud environments consisting of multiple services in line with the Microsoft Well Architected Framework.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $170,000.00 - $245,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 6 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: GIS Technical Lead - Remote
description:
**GIS Technical Lead/ Delivery Lead/ Delivery Manager**

**Location - Remote - PST time zone preferred** 

**Job Description**

Cyient Utilities practice is growing significantly based on demand driven by projects in System implementation and deployment of GIS based solutions.

In this regard, we are looking for a Technical Leader with the following responsibilities:

1. Understand the development in the various commercial GIS platforms and ensure the implementations and GIS solutions from Cyient are aligned to the same

2. As part of GIS implementation program kick-off, anchor and lead technical workshops with customers to understand their enterprise landscape, business and functional requirements, lead solution feasibility discussions along with Sr. Architects

3. Play a key role as a bridge between the execution team and customer during execution phase and help in managing customer expectation and lead the solution demonstrations.

4. Play an active role in developing/ validating the architecture, support resolution of complex technical issues and enable the team in planning the project and support the team as needed to ensure the program / project goals are met

5. Network with OEMS (Esri & GE) and be the brand ambassador for Cyient in the various technology forums by demonstrating Cyient thought leadership in this space

6. Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders - Delivery, Sales, Presales in developing winning proposals, defending the proposed solutions with customers and executing the same effectively.

7. Proactively define and drive the building of solutions in the GIS Space specific to mining, energy and Utilities.

Desired characteristics:

1. Strong knowledge of GIS domain with specific expertise and understanding of ArcGIS / Esri UN

2. Strong communication skills to be able to articulate the value proposition to customers, internal stakeholders and the team

3. A highly collaborative team player who can work towards the success of the program by owning the technical outcome of the projects

4. Be able to travel across the US to represent Cyient with various customers in workshops, contract meetings and also represent Cyient in various trade shows.

5. Flexible work timing to accommodate meetings with stakeholders across the globe.

title: NG911 Security Engineer
description:
UNIVERSAL Technologies is seeking a NG911 Security Engineer for a remote position in Brooklyn, NY. **Candidates must reside in the EST time zone.** 

**Position:** The NG911 Security Engineer will ensure the National Emergency Number Association (NENA) and Association of Public Safety Communication Officials (APCO) standards are being met during the implementation of a complex NG911 system by implementing new security controls, ensuring security controls are adequate for all Public Safety Answering points (PSAPs) in the commission of the 911 program at PSAP.

**WHO WE ARE:**  
UNIVERSAL Technologies, LLC is a Women-Owned (M/WBE) IT solutions and consulting company focused at delivering enterprise systems that significantly improve our clients IT performance. We work across the IT spectrum including Development, Business/Systems/Data Analysis, Project Management, Cyber Security, Network Engineering, and High-Level System Architecture.

The pride in the services we provide and the accessibility and flexibility we provide to employees are what make Universal Technologies stand out from the rest! We hope to propel your IT career to the next level and excite our employees with new and challenging projects.

**WHAT WE OFFER:**  
Our W2 employees can expect the following benefits:

* Competitive pay
* Health/Dental Insurance
* Group Life Insurance
* 401K
* HSA/FSA
* Pre-Tax Transportation Program
* Generous Paid Time Off/Holiday Policy

**MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:**

* Minimum of 12 years’ experience in Information Technology.
* Minimum of 6 years’ network Security Engineering experience.
* Strong network security experience.
* Strong project management experience with experience leading NG911 projects.
* Any compliance experience, specifically HIPAA, is highly desirable.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology or related field.
* Should be able to utilize security frameworks like NIST and MITRE.
* Strong knowledge of security management tools to facilitate troubleshooting, i.e. Wireshark, Net brain, Extra hop, Net witness, etc.
* Strong Identity and Access Management background.
* Experience with configuring DNS.
* Strong experience in performing security risk assessments.
* Understanding of VPN technologies.
* Knowledge of resilient designs to ensure high availability.
* Knowledge of IPS/IDS design as standalone hardware or as a feature within firewalls.
* Ability to create reports using KRI and KPI.
* Experience with Next Generation Firewalls including Palo alto, Fortinet, Forcepoint, etc.
* Understanding of SIP security design and implementation for Voice/Video and Data.
* Understanding for firewall policies and application security
* Experience in auditing/assessing data network security design.
* Experience in auditing/assessing applications security design**.**

**SCOPE OF SERVICES:**

* Participate in the implementation of security controls in a Public Safety ESINET and NENA compliant NG911 system.
* Ensure the National Emergency Number Association (NENA) and Association of Public Safety Communication Officials (APCO) standards are being met during the implementation of NG911.
* Ensure the security controls are adequate for all Public Safety Answering points (PSAPs) in the commission of the 911 program at PSAP.
* Develop security configuration of the ESINET Network Technology.
* Manage test cases and identify risks associated with system integrations.
* Provide security best practices in PSAPs.
* Review all vendor designs to ensure compliance with security standards and governance models established by the City of New York.
* Detect, manage, and investigate security monitoring tools.
* Provide expertise in integration and engineering of Security platforms.
* Collaborate with vendors to integrate security platforms into Public Safety infrastructure.
* Architect security controls.
* Assess Active Directory security roles and policies.
* Configure IDS/IPS security policies.
* Perform troubleshooting of Level 3 security related issues.
* Configure security policies in DNS.
* Examine current firewall policies and ensure completeness and accuracy.
* Lead resolution of security incidents.
* Collaborate with vendors, carriers, and other technical groups to implement new security controls and troubleshoot existing controls.

*UNIVERSAL Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $130.00 - $140.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* Do you reside in the EST time zone?
* Do you have a LinkedIn account?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Information Technology: 10 years (Required)
* Security Engineering: 6 years (Required)
* leading NG911 projects: 6 years (Required)
* configuring DNS: 6 years (Required)
* SIP security design: 6 years (Required)
* auditing/assessing data network security design: 6 years (Required)
* uditing/assessing applications security design: 6 years (Required)
* NextGen Firewalls: 6 years (Required)
* security frameworks (NIST/MITRE): 6 years (Required)
* ESINET: 6 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Architect
description:
About Us

We are a team of Architects, Senior Data, Application, and System Engineers, recognized for our elite capabilities in guiding clients worldwide through their digital transformation, data modernization, and cloud migration journeys. Our focus, predominantly in the data space, extends into a comprehensive array of services, including network infrastructure projects which are pivotal for our client's success in today's digital economy.

The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated CCIE Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. This is a unique opportunity to work with an elite group of professionals on cutting-edge projects. The role is fully remote, offering the flexibility to work from anywhere, designed for an individual ready to make an immediate impact.

Duration & Availability

* **Contract Length:** 6-12 months, full-time engagement
* **Start Date:** Within 2-3 weeks from the job posting, with a preference for near-immediate availability

Key Responsibilities

* Design, implement, and manage complex network infrastructure projects with a strong focus on Cisco Nexus series (9500, 9600, 9300) and Cisco ITD.
* Develop and maintain high-security network environments, incorporating Palo Alto firewalls and advanced load balancing techniques.
* Work closely with clients to architect and deploy network infrastructure that supports digital transformation, data warehouse modernization, and cloud migration initiatives.
* Lead projects with minimal oversight, demonstrating a strong ability to manage time, resources, and project deliverables.
* Collaborate with a team of elite Architects, Engineers, and Analysts to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.

Requirements

* **Certification:** Current CCIE certification is mandatory.
* **Experience:** Proven experience with Cisco Nexus 9500, 9600, 9300 series, and Cisco ITD. Strong background in managing Palo Alto firewalls and load balancing within complex environments.
* **Skills:** Exceptional technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fully remote setting. Strong communication and leadership qualities, capable of guiding teams and leading projects to success.
* **Contract Type:** Open to 1099 or Corporate-to-Corporate arrangements.

Ideal Candidate

title: Senior Wireless Solutions Architect
description:
**Summary:**


We are looking for a highly skilled Wireless Solutions Architect with a CCIE (Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert) certification to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in designing, implementing, and optimizing wireless networks, with a focus on Cisco technologies.


As a Wireless Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for developing end-to-end wireless solutions tailored to meet the needs of our clients. You will work closely with sales teams, customers, and engineers to design and implement robust wireless infrastructures that deliver reliable connectivity and optimal performance.

**Responsibilities:**

  

* Collaborate with sales teams to understand customer requirements and develop wireless solutions that address their business needs.
* Design, configure, and implement wireless network architectures using Cisco products and technologies.
* Conduct site surveys and assessments to gather information for wireless network design and optimization.
* Develop detailed network design documentation, including diagrams, configurations, and technical specifications.
* Provide technical guidance and support to project teams during the implementation phase.
* Troubleshoot complex wireless network issues and provide timely resolution.
* Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in wireless networking.
* Participate in knowledge sharing activities and contribute to the continuous improvement of processes and best practices.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.
* CCIE certification (Wireless) is required.
* Proven experience as a Wireless Solutions Architect or similar role.
* In-depth knowledge of wireless networking protocols, standards, and technologies (e.g., 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax, WLAN controllers, RF optimization).
* Hands-on experience with Cisco wireless products such as Cisco Aironet Access Points, Cisco Catalyst switches, Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers, and Cisco Prime Infrastructure.
* Strong understanding of network security principles and best practices.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients and stakeholders at all levels.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience in working with wireless technologies in an airport is preferred.

**Why we think this job is great:**

* It’s a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you’ll work from home.
* You’ll have clear goals, and the training resources you need to deliver. How you execute and deliver is up to you.

**About Us**


Bold Business is a remote-first, global outsourced solutions company with over $7B in service solutions over the past 25 years. Our international team helps the world’s leading companies transform their ideas into bold impacts. From Fortune 500 organizations looking to reduce operational costs by 40%-60% to fast-growth startups looking to scale, we work behind the scenes and empower companies to do more for less.

  

If you like to move fast and have a bias for action, you’ll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We’re a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are.

title: Staff Software Engineer - Backend
description:
\\*Recruiters please see our policy on unsolicited resumes: https://www.hihello.com/legal/hihello-unsolicited-resume-policy\\* **Hi, Hello!** **\\uD83D\\uDC4B**  

Want to join a diverse and exciting team that will revolutionize how the world thinks about digital brand identity? You’re in the right place.  

At HiHello we have created The Software Platform for Digital Brand and Identity. This platform enables companies of all sizes to leverage digital business cards, email signatures and virtual backgrounds to present their brand consistently in every interaction—whether that is in-person, over email, or on video.  

HiHello is venture-backed and was co-founded in 2018 by Dr. Manu Kumar, who previously founded Carta and CardMunch and invested in companies like Lyft, Twilio, Auth0, LucidChart, and Everlaw. HiHello’s customers span thousands of companies worldwide and across all industry segments. Every month, over a million HiHello cards are shared helping people to connect and grow their professional network while also helping to #savetheplanet.  

HiHello’s team comprises a diverse group of kind and respectful individuals across the Americas. We believe in working hard, having fun, inspiring greatness, helping others, embracing kindness, learning and leading, living and working flexibly, and communicating openly.  

Do you think you can help us get to the next level? We’d love to talk! **How you will make an impact:**  

We are building the Engineering team here at HiHello and looking for amazing people to come to join us. The ultimate goal is to build the next relationship network - something that is better and potentially very different than LinkedIn. We're building a product that appeals to individuals and enterprises (yes, both). We have people from all walks of life (from CEOs to Balloon Artists) who use our platform.  

Success in this role means thriving in an environment of autonomy, open-communication while having leadership and mentoring support. This role will be responsible for making this platform easy to use and attractive to non-technical users. You’re passionate about building APIs, knowledgeable of databases, and take great pride in providing performant solutions. When you ship something, you are confident that it is secure and balance iterating with shipping it.  

Lastly, you’re comfortable working with a remote team and using synchronous and asynchronous communications to collaborate effectively. You aren't afraid of trying new things but know when to pull back on something when it doesn't add value.
### **In this role, you'll get to:**

* Architect and develop solutions in Node.JS and TS to scale a complex platform
* Improve engineering processes, tooling, and efficiency; ci/cd pipelining, API’s, infrastructure
* Open communication within your team and cross-functionally to find solutions that serve us
* Mentor and guide team members

### **We are looking for people who have:**

* Passion for architecting and building strong backend solutions
* Strong proficiency in Node.js and Typescript
* Strong knowledge GraphQL APIs
* Experience with document storage such as Firebase Firestore or DynamoDB
* Previous experience with cloud providers such as Google Cloud or AWS
* Familiarity with Docker
* Hold themselves and their work to a high standard

### **Bonus Points:**

* Familiarity with DevOps and relevant tools such as Terraform, Kubernetes, Gitlab CI, GitHub Actions, etc
* Understanding of DNS, CDNs, and email deliverability, spam score issues
* Knowledge of AI/ML; you have data to back your decisions
* Experience with converting raw data to consumable charts
* Ability to use data to tell the story of our customers
* Passion to introduce new tech, and help our company make better product decisions

### **What’s in it for you:**

* Fully remote office, flexible working hours
* Unlimited paid time off
* Competitive compensation package (base salary + options/equity)
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance (US based)
* 401(k) (US based)
* Home office stipend
* Annual company retreat
* Opportunity to build things from scratch & make a significant impact
* Work with & learn from a kind, diverse, awesome team

**Our commitment to an inclusive culture:**  

At HiHello, we value everyone’s opinions and ideas. We believe that an inclusive environment harnesses the power of the innate diversity of our team. This allows us to drive innovative change by evaluating and adopting suggestions based on their value to our business and not the source of the idea. We know that embracing inclusion helps us, individually and collectively, to be better every day as a company and as people. We are committed to equal opportunity and welcome people of any gender identity, race, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, or any underrepresented group to apply.

title: Senior Network Engineer/ DDI Architect/ DNS Separation SME
description:
The Senior Network Engineer / DNS Separation Subject Matter Expert (SME) / DDI (DNS, DHCP, IP Address Management) Architect is a pivotal role within our technical team, responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing network infrastructure, with a specific emphasis on DNS separation strategies and DDI architecture. This multifaceted position requires extensive expertise in network engineering, DNS protocols, security principles, and DDI technologies. The individual will lead initiatives related to DNS separation, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and architect DDI solutions to enhance network performance, security, and scalability. Additionally, this role will involve providing assistance and consultation in transferring domains between registrars, managing the Cloudflare environment, and working closely with Cybersecurity, Network, and Security teams.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and implement DNS separation strategies to bolster network security and resilience.
* Lead DDI architecture initiatives, including the design and implementation of DNS, DHCP, IP Address Management (IPAM) solutions.
* Evaluate existing DNS infrastructure and develop comprehensive migration plans for separating DNS services.
* Coordinate the transfer of domains between registrars, ensuring seamless transitions and minimal disruption, and providing assistance and consultation in this area.
* Manage and optimize the Cloudflare environment, overseeing DNS configuration and performance enhancements, and providing consultation to other teams as needed.
* Collaborate closely with Cybersecurity, Network, and Security teams to align DNS separation initiatives with broader security objectives, providing assistance and consultation in network security matters.
* Oversee IP Address Management (IPAM), including the allocation, tracking, and documentation of IP addresses, subnetting, and DHCP configurations.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to junior engineers and team members.
* Perform advanced troubleshooting and resolution of complex DNS-related issues, including DNS spoofing, cache poisoning, and DDoS attacks.
* Conduct regular audits and assessments of DNS and DDI infrastructure to identify vulnerabilities and areas for improvement.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies related to DNS, DDI, IPAM, and network security.
* Develop comprehensive documentation, including diagrams, procedures, and guidelines for DNS separation, DDI architecture, and IPAM.
* Participate in cross-functional meetings and projects to ensure alignment with organizational goals and objectives.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Master’s degree preferred.
* Minimum of 5-year experience in network engineering roles, with a strong focus on DNS architecture, DDI solutions, and network security.
* Demonstrated expertise in DNS protocols (e.g., DNSSEC, DNS-over-TLS, DNS-over-HTTPS).
* Proficiency in designing and implementing DDI solutions, including DNS, DHCP, and IP Address Management.
* Experience with domain registrar management and transferring domains between registrars, providing consultation and assistance in this area.
* Strong knowledge of Cloudflare or similar CDN platforms, including DNS configuration and optimization, providing consultation and assistance to other teams.
* Effective communication and collaboration abilities, with the capability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.
* Industry certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, CISSP, or equivalent are highly desirable.
* Proven track record of success in leading complex network infrastructure projects.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Experience:

* DNS Separation SME/Senior Network Engineer: 5 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* CCNP, CCIE, CISSP (Preferred)

Security clearance:

* Confidential (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote
