title: Presales Engineer/Solutions Architect
description:
**Who we are**


Incredibuild empowers developers to radically accelerate their work by shortening build times, allowing more iterations and faster product releases. Thousands of customers including world-leading brands trust our platform to streamline and accelerate everything from compilation to release automation, generating great savings of resources and accelerating Time-To-Market for leading brands.


We’ve helped over 200,000 developers at tech giants like Microsoft, Samsung, Nintendo, Amazon, and many others to develop some of the most successful software in many industries such as gaming, financial services, Embedded software, and more.


In the past three years, Incredibuild has been in hyper-growth, expanding globally with no signs of slowing. We have secured multiple rounds of investments to keep expanding our market share.


This is your opportunity to join a category leader and make a difference.


To read more

  

We are seeking a dynamic and self-driven Solution Architect to join our Solution Architecture team. In this role, you will be instrumental in understanding our customers' needs, formulating effective solutions, and ensuring they derive maximum value from our cutting-edge solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to thrive in a challenging, fast-paced environment.

 **﻿What you'll be doing:**

* Lead technical and business discussions, articulating the unique value of Incredibuild.
* Serve as the technical owner throughout the sales cycle, ensuring a seamless experience for our customers.
* Conduct demo calls with prospects and potential partners, showcasing the power and capabilities of Incredibuild solutions.
* Manage end-to-end Proof of Concepts (POCs), including defining KPIs, implementation, execution, support, and delivering impactful results.
* Focus on providing value by deeply understanding customer pains and needs, and presenting tailored business solutions.
* Present Incredibuild solutions to diverse stakeholders, ranging from C-level executives to developers.
* Collaborate with Account Executives and prospects to technically qualify opportunities.

  

Requirements:  

  

**What You'll Need:**

* 3-5 years of experience as a Solution Architect, SE, or Solution Consultant.
* Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to present technology recommendations from a business perspective.
* Independent and self-driven, with a proven ability to work remotely.
* Proficient infrastructure wizard with expertise in Windows, Linux, network, and IT security in both on-premises and cloud environments.
* Knowledge of SDLC & CI/CD infrastructure, build systems, and ecosystem tools.
* Strong hands-on background with the ability to troubleshoot complex systems.
* Ability to work under pressure, managing multiple opportunities and POCs concurrently.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and remotely.
* Development experience, especially in C/C++ - **advantage.**

  

Compensation Range: $155,000-$200,000 base salary (+ benefits, including generous 401K, unlimited PTO, generous medical coverage, life insurance, commute expenses, food allowance). In addition to the base salary, this role includes the opportunity to earn performance-based compensation and/or a discretionary bonus, in accordance with the Company's policies. Compensation finally awarded will be commensurate with the candidate’s skills and experience.

title: Solutions Architect HPC
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

This commissioned technical-sales role is focused on the HPC and HPC/AI segment. You will be responsible for advising and influencing customer and partners. You will collaborate with other Intel teams and partners to architect solutions, enabling our targeted end-user customers achieve their technical and business goals. This position will interface with senior technical and business decision makers and drive customer market segment requirements and feedback into the business unit, to influence future products.

  

This individual will need to communicate, present, and influence audiences representing engineering, operations, and executives.  

Daily activities will include providing direct technical assistance and training while collaborating with Intel product groups, sales teams, solution providers, and end customers.


A successful candidate must possess:

* History of server Hardware/sw integration and configuration
* Experience of running typical HPC simulations.
* Willingness to understand and use AI Frameworks and topologies.
* Strong industry network with established technical and business relationships.
* Strong communication skills and willingness to effectively communicate with all management levels of internal and external organizations.
* Track record of working in complex matrixed environment and delivering results through collaboration

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. **This position is not eligible for Intel Immigration sponsorship.**

**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in STEM, Business or related and 4+ years of experience in architecting HPC and HPC/AI solutions or technical understanding of Processor Architecture, HPC System Architecture, Benchmarking, SW, Analytics and AI.
* Or 5+ years' experience in HPC technical sales, technical sales support, or a technical marketing role supporting sales in lieu of the degree.
**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

  

Annual Salary Range for jobs which could be performed in US, Colorado, New York, Washington, California: $181,145.00-$289,863.00  

* Salary range dependent on a number of factors including location and experience

**Working Model**
-----------------

  

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. **In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.**  

JobType


Fully Remote

title: Software Engineer, L4, Open Connect Probnik
description:
Remote, United States
Open Connect is a critical group within Netflix that builds and manages a content delivery network (CDN) handling more than one third of North American internet traffic at peak times! We strive to deliver a great Netflix viewing experience in over 190 countries so our customers can watch whatever, whenever, interruption free. Over 260 million members around the globe are currently enjoying more than 16 billion hours per month of original series, documentaries and feature films. Come work alongside some of the best and most experienced engineers of the CDN industry.  

Open Connect Appliances (OCAs) are ideally situated to improve the latency between clients and the Netflix services running on AWS. The Open Connect Edge Accelerator is taking advantage of the highly geo-distributed nature of Open Connect to improve the quality of experience. It is the entry point for device and website traffic, putting it on the critical path to delivering and monitoring our product experiences. You can learn more about us by watching this QCon talk presented by Sergey from our team. We are looking for a software engineer to improve the solution and build new features. You will be working on latency measurement, steering solutions, protocol optimizations and to name a few.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Develop and maintain the Probnik service in production
* Partner with other teams across engineering to gather and implement new requirements
* Setup, run and analyze network measurements
**You are**
-----------

* Someone who likes to work hands-on and be self-directed in a fast-paced environment that gives you freedom and responsibility.
* Able to see beyond immediate specs, summarize requirements, and architect forward-looking solutions.
* Capable of working in a cross-functional collaborative environment alongside your teammates.
* An advocate for the customer who is passionate about addressing customer pain points.
**Requirements**
----------------

* 4+ years of previous experience in a Software Engineering role
* Professional level proficiency in Java, Python, Go or Javascript
* Experience developing and operating services receiving high scale traffic
* Data crunching using Hive, Pig, Kibana, Tableau, or similar.
* Good understanding of the Internet protocols like TCP, TLS, HTTP and DNS.
* Great communication and documentation skills targeted at cross-team collaboration.
* Motivated by “the art of possible” and able to balance idealism and pragmatism.
* Cool-headed during production issues, able to focus on problem resolution.
  

Does this sound interesting? Or does this sound interesting but intimidating? Please don’t self-select out, let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!  

Netflix is a global company with a diverse member base, which is why the content we produce reflects that: global perspectives and global stories. As we grow globally, we must have the most talented employees with diverse backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to support our innovation and creativity. We are an equal-opportunity employer and strive to build balanced teams from all walks of life.  

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.  

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $500,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: Cloud Architect - Remote
description:
**Pharmacy Benefits Reinvented-** As the industry’s alternative pharmacy benefit manager (PBM), we’re committed to making prescriptions more affordable for you and your members. Here at Navitus, our team members work in an environment that celebrates creativity, fosters diversity and encourages growth. We welcome new ideas and share a passion for excellence.


The **Cloud Architect** ensures efforts are in alignment with the Enterprise Architecture team to support customer-focused objectives and the IT Vision, a collaborative partner delivering innovative ideas, solutions, and services to simplify people's lives. The Cloud Architect will create and execute cloud computing strategies. The Cloud Architect is responsible for designing, development and managing cloud infrastructure and assets in support of corporate initiatives in cloud computing and automation, with a focus on the design of systems and services that run on cloud platforms.


The Cloud Architect will be responsible for ensuring that critical applications are designed and optimized for high availability and disaster recovery, while also ensuring alignment with strategic direction and cost optimized solutions.


Is this you? Find out more below!

**How do I make an impact on my team?**

* Architecting, building, and maintaining cost-efficient, scalable cloud environments for the organization
* Provides hands-on technical coaching to accelerate cloud learning across the Cloud foundations team and product teams
* Create a well-informed cloud strategy and manage the adaption process
* Designing, building, maintaining internal cloud applications for the organization utilizing stakeholder feedback
* Transferring data and internal processes to cloud architecture
* Documents complex procedures and complex troubleshooting procedures related to systems/networks software and hardware
* Excellent knowledge of cloud computing technologies and current computing trends
* Analyze current technologies used within the company and determine ways to improve
* Provides mentoring to the team for technical challenges
* Designs and Implements solutions based on Architectural best practices
* Implements re-architecting existing applications on Cloud to AWS
* Keeping cloud environments secure and preventing downtime or security breaches
* Design reference architecture and provide input to the DevOps team for implementation of codified stacks that meet the needs of the applications
* Lead the effort to automate and set up traditional infrastructure components as well as cloud native infrastructure and middleware in both on-premises and public cloud environments heavily utilizing Infrastructure as Code practices
* Oversee and lead disaster recovery planning, testing, and auditing

**What our team expects from you?**

* A four-year college degree required in the field of computer science and/or a minimum of 7+ years of professional experience in application, software, and infrastructure design and implementation
* Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure
* Experience in software engineering and design architecture
* Healthcare industry practices and HIPAA knowledge preferred
* Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws
* Participate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectives
* The ability to consistently interact cooperatively and respectfully with other employees

**What can you expect from Navitus?**

* Hours/Location: Monday – Friday: 8:00am-5:00pm CST, Remote
* Paid Volunteer Hours
* Educational Assistance Plan and Professional Membership assistance
* Referral Bonus Program – up to $750!
* Top of the industry benefits for Health, Dental, and Vision insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Eight paid holidays, 401K, Short-term and Long-term disability, College Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance Program, and Employee Assistance Program

title: Systems Architect
description:
Company Introduction  

9th Way Insignia is a service-disabled, veteran-owned small business bringing transformative technology to our government customers so they can achieve their missions. Our specialties include cybersecurity, cloud modernization, software development, data analytics, enterprise architecture, enterprise IT, analytics and artificial intelligence. Learn more about 9th Way Insignia at https://9thwayinsignia.com/  

  

Team (Project) Introduction  

9th Way Insignia will work with the Veterans Administration (VA) to support the governance pillar in creating, implementing, and providing support for the necessary requirements and outcomes of the Zero Trust assessments (ZTA). 9th Way Insignia will provide iterative updates for pillar use cases while accounting for a risk based and dependency-based priority of capabilities.  

  

Professional Level Information:  

The Technical Systems Architect aligns within 9th Way Insignia as a Level 4H Hybrid Manager/Lead. A Hybrid Manager at 9th Way Insignia accomplishes department objectives by managing staff and processes and evaluating department activities. Focuses on leading a team and working hands-on with projects involving technology. Hybrid Managers require skills and qualifications such as exceptional leadership, communication and interpersonal skills.  

  

Functional Job (LCAT) Information:  

An Expert Technical Systems Architect has extensive experience in the design and development of Client Server and Web Enabled Corporate applications including network topology. Must be well versed in Object Oriented tools and techniques. Must have thorough knowledge of data modeling skills using automated tools.  

  

Responsibilities:
* Provide technical leadership at an enterprise level to migrate legacy systems to a Zero Trust Architecture for the agency. Over 100 systems will need to be migrated to ZTA.
* Supports ZTA management team in recommending and creating technical solutions
* Will recommend security requirements and provide architectural direction to improve cybersecurity
* Will work with the Agency Enterprise Architect
* Provides system engineering and architectural design support services

Requirements*:*
* 10+ years of experience in cybersecurity
* Master of Science degree (or higher) in one of the following: computer science, electronics engineering, computer engineering, computer science, information technology, or cybersecurity or 10 years of additional experience
* Experience securing cloud-based systems
* Knowledge of Zero Trust Architecture
* Must have excellent interpersonal and technical skills as will be working with important stakeholders at all levels.


  

Preferred/Desired:
* CISSP
* GIAC Security Essentials Certification
* RMF, CSF, FISMA, and Fedramp
* Familiarity with: ZTNA and SASE Framework, ICAM (OKTA), CWPP, SOC Operations, Vulnerability Threat Management, and Compliance


  

Salary Range:  

The salary range for this position is$101,188 to 160,000.  

  

*9th Way Insignia’s range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.*  

  

Location:  

This position is remote.  

  

*9th Way Insignia reserves the right to adjust work location based upon mission requirements.*  

  

Clearance, background investigation:  

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.  

  

Legal:  

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Infrastructure Architect 3DEXPERIENCE
description:
`**Remote Full-time Mid-level**

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Support the installation of **3D**EXPERIENCE On-Premises environments, globally.
* Work with the Solution Architect to bring technical infrastructure expertise and recommendations on client projects.
* Conduct interviews with customers to gather requirements on the IT landscape.
* Drive the hardware/network/infrastructure assessment.
* Design and document the technical integration of DS solutions within the customer's current information system by leveraging architectural design methods, patterns, and best practices.
* Support current **3D**EXPERIENCE On-Premises clients with the ability to troubleshoot/resolve software implementation and configuration issues.
* Willing to learn and use new software product skills for consulting or technical sales activities.
* Ability to perform in a fast-paced, results-focused environment.
* Ability to travel on a frequent/as-needed basis within the assigned territories.
* Familiarization with Azure or AWS, vCenter or Hyper-V, and a good understanding of TLS/SSL certificates.
* Audit and propose **3D**EXPERIENCE infrastructure in line with the customer requirements. This includes tuning/configuring Dassault Systèmes **3D**EXPERIENCE products and related key software components such as operating systems, databases, applications, and web servers.

title: Principal Network Architect (Remote)
description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role  

CrowdStrike Information Technology is looking for a Principal Network Architect to join the IT Network Engineering team, which plays a critical role building network infrastructure that supports all CrowdStrike teams. The person in this position will play a key role, driving network architecture in a collaborative environment that will enable the team to build and support the network at scale. The successful candidate will also create architecture documentation in alignment with industry best practices and provide technical leadership to functional project teams and cross-team major initiatives.  

  

This is an opportunity to work in a dynamic, robust, fast-paced and challenging environment. Candidates should be interested in expanding their breadth of knowledge, continually learning new technologies and processes, and solving difficult problems by thinking quickly and developing innovative solutions.  

Duties and Responsibilities* Collaborate with team members, IT leadership, and enterprise stakeholders on cloud, data center, and premise network architecture for global scale; document problem statements, project requirements, and architecture details
* Lead the development and execution of an architecture roadmap for networking at global scale and drive ongoing efforts to ensure that the roadmap is aligned with business needs
* Provide clear and concise recommendations to remediate performance/scaling bottlenecks
* Create and update graphical and written network architecture documentation following industry best practices
* Maintain expertise in routing, switching, load balancing, wireless networking, and network security technologies to ensure that cost-effective solutions and processes are deployed and aligned with business and security needs
* Monitor network infrastructure and traffic; identify and document problem areas and recommend network infrastructure and performance improvements based on current and projected enterprise network environment
* Assess new technologies and best practices for adoption
* Drive standardization and automation in all aspects of the network environment
* Create and maintain graphical and written network architecture, infrastructure, and technical standards documentation
* Communicate with all stakeholders in a timely, clear, and concise manner
* Prepare and deliver professional presentations to technical and non-technical audiences at all levels
* Provide technical leadership to functional project teams and cross-team major initiatives


Required Skills* 10+ years’ experience architecting scalable cloud, data center and office network infrastructure using public cloud technology and enterprise-class routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, and wireless networking devices
* 10+ years’ experience with OSPF, EIGRP, BGP, and multicast routing protocols, Voice Over IP, and QoS configuration on routers and switches in enterprise environments using IPv4
* 5+ years’ experience architecting multi-region/AZ/VPC cloud and hybrid cloud networks within AWS and other major public cloud environments, including GCP and/or Azure; AWS experience must include AWS VPN, Direct Connect, transit gateway, VPC peering, Network ACLs and security groups, ELB, Route 53; experience with other public cloud environments must include the equivalent cloud networking elements
* 5+ years’ experience configuring, managing, and monitoring Palo Alto Networks firewalls using Panorama
* Experience managing and deploying premise and Global Server Load Balancing (GSLB) platforms such as F5 Networks LTM/GTM
* 5+ years’ experience with enterprise wireless networking solutions such as Aruba, Cisco, or Meraki
* Demonstrated experience with network configuration management and monitoring tools
* Demonstrated experience with access control technologies such as Cisco ISE and Aruba ClearPass
* Experience with documentation and presentation tools such as Google Suite, Microsoft Office, Visio, and Atlassian Wiki
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with members of multiple teams in multiple global regions
* Must speak fluent English and communicate clearly in written English
* Must possess a valid driver’s license and own a working vehicle with current registration and insurance
* Must be capable of lifting 50lbs
* Must be willing to travel occasionally to data centers, CrowdStrike offices, and other locations


Preferred Skills* Public cloud architecture and networking certification (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Advanced Cisco networking certification (CCNP R&S, CCIE R&S)
* Advanced understanding of IP addressing and subnetting, TCP/IP, and DNS
* Proficiency with protocol and log analysis tools
* Proficiency in at least one scripting language such as Python or shell scripting
* Proficiency with SD-WAN and network automation using orchestration platforms, scripting and REST APIs
* Willingness to represent IT with professionalism, demonstrating CrowdStrike core values and behaviors
* Strong interest in continuing networking education and certification


#LI-Remote
#LI-Rl1
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:* Remote-first culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
* Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
* Physical and mental wellness programs
* Paid parental leave, including adoption
* A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
* Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration


We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com, for further assistance.
CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.
Notice of E-Verify Participation
Right to Work
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $135.000 - $200.000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location.
Expected Close Date of Job Posting is:04-05-2024

title: Network Analyst II
description:
*Agile Defense provides leading-edge Digital Transformation solutions to support and advance our customers' mission. We deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers worldwide through an empowered and engaged workforce.* **Requisition #:** 20 **Job Title:** Network Analyst II **Location:** Ashburn, VA **(Remote)** **Clearance Level:** Active CBP Suitability, DHS Suitability, Active TS **Salary Range:** $49,260 - $73,890
**SUMMARY**
Customs Border Patrol (CBP) has a global presence with connectivity to approximately 1300 field sites as well as Other Government Agencies (OGAs) and trade partners. CBP conducts operations in 22 countries, 328 ports of entry, 129 border patrol stations within 22 sectors, and 75 AMO locations. To support its mission, CBP needs a robust, resilient, and high performing enterprise network and supporting services throughout its global footprint. The Network Services Division within the Office of Information and Technology (OIT) Enterprise Infrastructure and Operations Directorate (EIOD) provides network services and oversight of the CBP enterprise network infrastructure and comprises the Network Architecture and Engineering Division (NAED) and Network Operations Division (NOD).
The Network Analyst II provides direct support to the Senior Mobility Engineer with Mobile Device Management (MDM) user support and issue resolution. Candidate should have working experience in supporting Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and MDM solutions at large scale Enterprise customers with proven delivery in supporting, maintaining and troubleshooting “complex” AirWatch or equivalent MDM systems. The Network Analyst II (Mobility Support) supports the Solutions Architect with design and implementation tasks and address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues. **JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions
Support, maintain and troubleshoot AirWatch systems
Support the design and implementation of simple MDM solutions
Support escalation and root cause analysis activities
Support of all updates to all documents when there is change in the transport design and/or technologies and collaborating with all stakeholders to test all related systems and processes to verify that the systems meet requirements and can host applications with no degradation to performance or security
Address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues
Work with the Solution Architect to implement solutions
Provide network administration support: firewalls, general network infrastructure and security fundamentals, VPN, DNS
Follow and perform ITIL Incident, problem and requirements management
Develop and implement test strategies and documents results
Provides documentation, guidance and training to end-users as needed
Receive mentoring for MDM Airwatch solutions design and implementation by solutions architect
Responsible for the preparation of test reports and Implementation Plans for each change impacting the Production environment **QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Certifications**
Eligibility/Clearance Requirements: Must be a U.S. Citizen with an active clearance.
Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st priority
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret - 2nd choice
DoD Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd choice (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated) **Education, Background, and Years of Experience**
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT Systems, or other related discipline. Education requirement may be substituted with an additional 4 years of relevant experience.
2-4 years’ work experience as a System Administrator – supporting, maintaining and troubleshooting MDM systems AND Smart Devices (Apple, Android devices like tablet and smart phone, Windows iOS, etc. **ADDITIONAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Skills**
Experience with firewalls, VPN, DNS and general network and network security infrastructure
Strong understanding of servers & configuration & maintenance: Windows Server 2008 / 2003 / 2013, Exchange, 0365, Azure AD, Active Directory, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache), Linux Forms (Ubuntu, Fedora, RedHat, Photon, Open Suse), other mail systems, web certifications such as SSL and IIS
Strong knowledge of ITIL based Service Management workflow applications such as incident, problem, and requirements management: Authentication, Certificate system, etc.
Technical Certifications or demonstrable experience in in one or more MDM Products (AirWatch, MobileIron, XenMobile, Symantec MDM, Good Tech)
Seeking candidate who can mentor, teach and grow a small team from within to support growing customer requirements.
Must have great communication and documentation skills.
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. **WORKING CONDITIONS** **Environmental Conditions**
Fully Remote (Must be within a 4 hour driving distance from the NCR).  

  

**Strength Demands**
Medium – 50 lbs. Maximum lifting with frequent lift/carry up to 25 lbs. **Physical Requirements**
Stand or Sit; Walk; Repetitive Motion; Use Hands / Fingers to Handle or Feel; Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl; See; Push or Pull; Climb (stairs, ladders) or Balance (ascend / descend, work atop, traverse).
*Employees of Agile Defense are our number one priority, and the importance we place on our culture here is fundamental. Our culture is alive and evolving, but it always stays true to its roots. Here, you are valued as a family member, and we believe that we can accomplish great things together. Agile Defense has been highly successful in the past few years due to our employees and the culture we create together. We believe several attributes are the root of our very best employees and extraordinary culture. We have named these attributes “The 6 H’s” – Happy, Helpful, Honest, Humble, Hungry, and Hustle.*  

***Happy****: We exhibit a positive outlook in order to create a positive environment.****Helpful****: We assist each other and pull together as teammates to deliver.****Honest****: We conduct our business with integrity.****Humble****: We recognize that success is not achieved alone, that there is always more to learn, and that no task is below us.****Hungry****: We desire to consistently improve.****Hustle****: We work hard and get after it.* *These Core Values are present in all our employees and our organization's aspects. Learn more about us and our culture by visiting us* *here.* ***COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements****Agile Defense is subject to federal vaccine mandates or other customer/facility vaccination requirements as a federal contractor. As such, to protect its employees' health and safety and comply with customer requirements, Agile Defense may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements.* **Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities**
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Cloud Engineer I
description:
*Agile Defense provides leading-edge Digital Transformation solutions to support and advance our customers' mission. We deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers worldwide through an empowered and engaged workforce.* **Requisition #:** 17  

  

**Job Title:** Cloud Engineer I **Location:** Ashburn, VA **(Remote)** **Clearance Level:** Active CBP Suitability, DHS Suitability, Active TS  

**SUMMARY**
Customs Border Patrol (CBP) has a global presence with connectivity to approximately 1300 field sites as well as Other Government Agencies (OGAs) and trade partners. CBP conducts operations in 22 countries, 328 ports of entry, 129 border patrol stations within 22 sectors, and 75 AMO locations. To support its mission, CBP needs a robust, resilient, and high performing enterprise network and supporting services throughout its global footprint. The Network Services Division within the Office of Information and Technology (OIT) Enterprise Infrastructure and Operations Directorate (EIOD) provides network services and oversight of the CBP enterprise network infrastructure and comprises the Network Architecture and Engineering Division (NAED) and Network Operations Division (NOD).
Working with an enterprise network architecture and engineering team supporting our Federal customer, the Cloud Engineer provides network engineering guidance into Cloud specific deployment projects and application architecture. The Cloud Engineer is responsible for the engineering, design, test, and implementation of secure and reliable network connectivity to cloud services (e.g., commercial cloud services providers (CSPs), private cloud, and hybrid cloud) leveraging the current network environment to facilitate migration of applications to the cloud. Responsible for the support of the development of the Technical Requirements Document and a Detailed Design Document (DDD) for the Cloud Connectivity Architecture, consistent with the associated Functional Requirements Document and DDD, before transitioning to Operations. Responsibility includes the support of all updates to all documents when there is change in the cloud design and/or technologies and collaborating with all stakeholders to test all cloud related systems and application migration processes to verify that the systems meet requirements and can host applications with no degradation to performance or security. This engineer is responsible for the preparation of test reports and Implementation Plans for each change impacting the cloud network environment. **JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
Building Secure Cloud Interconnect (SCI), Netbond, Direct Connect and VPN connections
Lead Migration from legacy on-prem networking to the Cloud Networking
Deploy and manage virtual servers in the Cloud
Deploy and manage containers in the Cloud
Deploy and manage elastic IPs and elastic network interfaces in the Cloud
Deploy and manage Cloud based load balancing
Research, evaluate, and recommend new cloud technologies
Provide internal consulting, technical guidance, information and support to application developers, computer operations, company management and departmental clients. Assists in internal training programs **QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Certifications**
Eligibility/Clearance Requirement: Must be a U.S. Citizen
Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st priority
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret or Secret - 2nd choice
DoD Secret or Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd choice (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated) **Education, Background, and Years of Experience**
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT Systems, or other related discipline. Education requirement may be substituted with an additional 4 years of relevant experience.
At least 7 years of hands-on experience in Network Design, Network Engineering, Network Operational Support and Cloud engineering experience of Medium to Large enterprise network environments. **ADDITIONAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Skills**
Experience building Secure Cloud Interconnect (SCI), Netbond, Direct Connect and VPN connections
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Public and Private Cloud
Experience with Azure Cloud
Experience with Google Cloud
Experience with Cloud Service Routers (CSRv)
Experience building Secure Cloud Interconnect (SCI)
Experience migrating from legacy on-prem networking to the Cloud Networking
Experience with Cloud Identity and Access Management
Experience deploying and managing virtual servers in the Cloud
Experience deploying and managing containers in the Cloud
Experience deploying and managing elastic IPs and elastic network interfaces in the Cloud
Experience deploying and managing Cloud based load balancers
Experience with implementing audit trails
Experience with Cloud based monitoring solutions
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills **Preferred Skills**
Desired certifications: AWS: Networking and/or Security Specialty, Solutions Architect Associate or Professional **WORKING CONDITIONS** **Environmental Conditions**
Fully Remote (Remote candidates need to be within 4 hours driving distance from NCR.)  

  

**Strength Demands**
Medium – 50 lbs. Maximum lifting with frequent lift/carry up to 25 lbs. **Physical Requirements**
Stand or Sit; Walk; Repetitive Motion; Use Hands / Fingers to Handle or Feel; Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl; See; Push or Pull; Climb (stairs, ladders) or Balance (ascend / descend, work atop, traverse).
*Employees of Agile Defense are our number one priority, and the importance we place on our culture here is fundamental. Our culture is alive and evolving, but it always stays true to its roots. Here, you are valued as a family member, and we believe that we can accomplish great things together. Agile Defense has been highly successful in the past few years due to our employees and the culture we create together. We believe several attributes are the root of our very best employees and extraordinary culture. We have named these attributes “The 6 H’s” – Happy, Helpful, Honest, Humble, Hungry, and Hustle.*  

***Happy****: We exhibit a positive outlook in order to create a positive environment.****Helpful****: We assist each other and pull together as teammates to deliver.****Honest****: We conduct our business with integrity.****Humble****: We recognize that success is not achieved alone, that there is always more to learn, and that no task is below us.****Hungry****: We desire to consistently improve.****Hustle****: We work hard and get after it.* *These Core Values are present in all our employees and our organization's aspects. Learn more about us and our culture by visiting us* *here.* ***COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements****Agile Defense is subject to federal vaccine mandates or other customer/facility vaccination requirements as a federal contractor. As such, to protect its employees' health and safety and comply with customer requirements, Agile Defense may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements.* **Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities**
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Cloud Solutions Architect
description:
*Agile Defense provides leading-edge Digital Transformation solutions to support and advance our customers' mission. We deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers worldwide through an empowered and engaged workforce.* **Requisition #:** 13 **Job Title:** Cloud Solutions Architect **Location:** Ashburn, VA **(Remote)** **Clearance Level:** Active DoD - CBP Suitability, DHS Suitability, Active TS **Salary Range:** $128,209 - $192,313**SUMMARY**
Customs Border Patrol (CBP) has a global presence with connectivity to approximately 1300 field sites as well as Other Government Agencies (OGAs) and trade partners. CBP conducts operations in 22 countries, 328 ports of entry, 129 border patrol stations within 22 sectors, and 75 AMO locations. To support its mission, CBP needs a robust, resilient, and high performing enterprise network and supporting services throughout its global footprint. The Network Services Division within the Office of Information and Technology (OIT) Enterprise Infrastructure and Operations Directorate (EIOD) provides network services and oversight of the CBP enterprise network infrastructure and comprises the Network Architecture and Engineering Division (NAED) and Network Operations Division (NOD).
Working with an enterprise network architecture and engineering team supporting our Federal customer, the Cloud Architect interfaces with customers to determine technical requirements, feasibility and expectations and strategizes with the client to develop solutions based on a variety of criteria including a clear description of services, functionality, scalability, future proofing, and cost. The Cloud Architect is responsible for designing cloud-based solutions using cloud computing architectural procedures that typically consists of a front-end platform, back end platforms, cloud-based delivery, and a network. Responsible for the support of the development of the Technical Requirements Document and a Detailed Design Document (DDD) for the Cloud Connectivity Architecture, consistent with the associated Functional Requirements Document and DDD, before transitioning to Operations. Responsibility includes designing and communicating compelling solutions that urge prospects to take the desired action and implementing cloud computing architecture solutions that address cloud security and compliance fundamentals, deployment automation and elastic sizing of environments, and multi-tenant implications. Additionally, the Cloud Architect will manage the implementation of the cloud to ensure a successful deployment. **JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
Build Secure Cloud Interconnect (SCI), Netbond, Direct Connect and VPN connections.
Lead Migration from legacy on-prem networking to the Cloud Networking.
Provide expert guidance in one or more Cloud Infrastructure (IaaS) offerings and be comfortable discussing solutions with clients.
Design and implement multi-tier architecture solution that is highly available and fault tolerant using Cloud platform services.
Design and implement effective cloud computing solutions that take into account an organization’s structure, communications, and operational business processes, including financial management and cost model implications.
 Manage the process of migrating and transition to a cloud environment.
 Analyze current workloads, migrate existing IT systems to the cloud, an configure new systems or services to enhance business operations. **QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Certifications**
Eligibility/Clearance - Must be a U.S. Citizen.

CBP Full BI - 1st priority

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT Systems, or other related discipline.
At least 4 years of hands-on experience in Network Design, Network Engineering, Network Operational Support and Cloud engineering experience of Medium to Large enterprise network environments. Education requirement may be substituted with an additional 4 years of relevant experience. **ADDITIONAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Skills**
Programming and scripting experience in programming languages like C#, Python, Java, or JavaScript
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Public and Private Cloud
Experience with Azure Cloud
Experience with Google Cloud
Experience with Cloud Service Routers (CSRv)
Experience performing requirements gathering with a prospective customer and tailoring a custom product and solution.
Experience with Cloud Identity and Access Management
Experience migrating from legacy on-prem networking to the Cloud Networking
Thorough understanding of Cloud Computing: virtualization technologies, Infrastructure as a Service, Platform as a Service and Software as a Service Cloud delivery models and the current competitive landscape
Thorough understanding of infrastructure (firewalls, load balancers, hypervisor, storage, monitoring, security, etc.) and have experience with orchestration to develop a cloud solution.
A data-driven critical thinking mind, analytical expertise, and a solution-driven, service-oriented personality.
 A knack for working in a similar fast-paced, high-SLA, deadline driven environment.
 Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. **Preferred Skills**
Desired Certifications: AWS - Networking and/or Security Specialty, Solutions Architect Associate or Professional **WORKING CONDITIONS** **Environmental Conditions**
 Fully remote candidates need to be within 4 hours driving distance from NCR. **Strength Demands**

 Stand or Sit; Walk; Repetitive Motion; Use Hands / Fingers to Handle or Feel; Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl; See; Push or Pull; Climb (stairs, ladders) or Balance (ascend / descend, work atop, traverse).

title: Remote-Sr IT Architect (Healthcare)-1099/W2(No C2C)-Michigan (Urgent/ 6+mo)
description:
**Health Care Experience is MUST**

Good Morning!

The following are **multiple openings** we have available.\\_ **Healthcare payer experience is required.** \\_Thank you!

**PLEASE NOTE: All candidates must have valid LinkedIn Profile.**

**Remote - Sr IT Architect/ Michigan/ 6+ Months**

**Required Qualifications:**

**Senior IT Architect**

**Location: Michigan- Remote**

**Duration: 6 months**

**Description:**

**Dept: Senior Health Services IT**

**Engagement Description :**

This solution architect role supports projects originating from Senior Health Services portfolio and supports end to end business functions including enrollment, billing , claims and servicing functions.

The architect will partner with business stakeholders to understand the business strategy, discuss solutions and options taking into consideration the Future state ecosystem.

Once a solution is developed, the architect will create a ROM, candidate architecture and actively participate in the project delivery team.

The architect becomes a trusted partner within business and IT across the Enterprise.

**In this IT Architect Sr/Solution Architect opportunity, you will:**

Analyze the different elements of business process and technology that can be applied to solve a specific problem.

Propose a combination of building blocks that provides the best possible solution within the Enterprise.

Design a solution for an existing or new problem and support the tasks and activities that are involved with its successful implementation.

Provide overall direction, guidance, definition, and facilitation for the development of an architecture (current and future state) required to meet business strategies and goals

Conceive solutions, build consensus, and sell/execute solutions.

Interact with the business partners, vendors, and technical resources.

Develop, writes, and communicates the architectural roadmap to technical resources.

Work on multiple highly complex projects that require in-depth knowledge of two or more functional architecture areas such as security, data, or systems.

**Top 3 Required Skills/Experience :**

Understanding of end-to-end healthcare payor functions.

Solution definition and problem-solving skills.

Experience in software engineering and architecture design

**Required Skills/Experience – The rest of the required skills/experience. Include:** 

Previous healthcare payor experience as a solution architect

Expert in development of architecture artifacts like conceptual solution architectural documents aligning to enterprise technology direction.

Conduct formal and informal meetings with appropriate subject matter experts in both large group and one-on-one sessions.

Research, analyze and translate complex systems/processes in-order to develop appropriate future state solutions.

**Five (5) years of experience in multiple IT areas (data, network, application, systems, etc.) required.**

Requires advanced level knowledge and understanding of architecture, application design, systems engineering and integration.

**Education/Certifications – Include:**

Bachelor's degree in related field

Job Type: Contract

Pay: Up to $80.00 per hour

Experience level:

* 11+ years

* LinkedIn URL?
* Expected Payrate on 1099 & Payrate on W2?

* Healthcare: 8 years (Preferred)

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Who is Blueprint?**



We are a technology solutions firm headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with a strong presence across the United States. Unified by a shared passion for solving complicated problems, our people are our greatest asset. We use technology as a tool to bridge the gap between strategy and execution, powered by the knowledge, skills, and the expertise of our teams, who all have unique perspectives and years of experience across multiple industries. We're bold, smart, agile, and fun.


**What does Blueprint do?**



Blueprint helps organizations unlock value from existing assets by leveraging cutting-edge technology to create additional revenue streams and new lines of business. We connect strategy, business solutions, products, and services to transform and grow companies.


**Why Blueprint?**



At Blueprint, we believe in the power of possibility and are passionate about bringing it to life. Whether you join our bustling product division, our multifaceted services team or you want to grow your career in human resources, your ability to make an impact is amplified when you join one of our teams. You'll focus on solving unique business problems while gaining hands-on experience with the world's best technology. We believe in unique perspectives and build teams of people with diverse skillsets and backgrounds. At Blueprint, you'll have the opportunity to work with multiple clients and teams, such as data science and product development, all while learning, growing, and developing new solutions. We guarantee you won't find a better place to work and thrive than at Blueprint.s



We are looking for a **Solutions Architect** to join us as we build cutting-edge technology solutions! Our team is looking for a talented engineering/architect leader with a strong background in building robust and scalable solutions across various domains including data warehousing, ETL, big data/analytics, data science, and cloud platforms, specifically Azure and Databricks. This role is responsible for conducting architectural design sessions, leading project implementation, and driving the creation of MVP's or Proof of Concept (PoC's). The ideal candidate will have experience building and leading data engineering teams in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment.


**Responsibilities**:


* Serve as the Primary Architecture-Engagement-Lead with a focus on Azure and Databricks.
* Define processes, standards, and guidelines for architecting data platforms, Data Estates, and modern ELT/ETL, Compute, Storage, Consumption for BI, and Data Science workloads on Azure.
* Support delivery teams as a senior technical leader in a hands-on capacity to remove blockers, create demos, proofs of concepts, and troubleshoot solutions with other engineers.
* Coach clients in adopting technology to solve their core business needs and issues relating to data, BI, data science, and analytics services on Azure.
* Be the go-to resource for our clients through increasing your knowledge and approach with new and existing technologies on Azure and Databricks.
* Lead collaboration with both internal and external stakeholders.
* Quickly understand client's business needs, make impactful recommendations, and adjust accordingly to needs as they change.
* Define architecture roadmaps with the ability to design a phased approach to completion while considering pre-existing, legacy challenges on Azure and Databricks.
* Demonstrated experience in cloud architecture and technologies, specifically on Azure.
* Aid in defining the scope of work and drafting proposals and contracts sent to clients for new business.
* Build and maintain Blueprint's lab/demo environment, with working demonstrations on data estate patterns and concepts, e.g., Azure, Databricks, ELT, Streaming, BI, and Data Analytics.


**Qualifications:**


* 5+ years of experience in the design and implementation of large-scale data platforms/solutions using Microsoft Azure.
* Expert knowledge of Azure services with a focus on Modern Data Solutions and Frameworks, adapters/connectors, and orchestration components.
* Experience with Databricks or other Azure data services and associated languages such as Python, SQL, etc.
* Demonstrated experience in designing and building cloud and hybrid solutions that run on Azure, including: (Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network, Azure Storage, Azure Monitoring, Azure Security).
* Expert knowledge of Azure services: (Azure DevOps, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Functions, API Management, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Identity and Access Management, Azure Data Factory).
* 5+ years of experience in SQL, data transformations, migration, statistical analysis, and troubleshooting across more than one Database Platform (Azure SQL Database, PostgreSQL, Databricks, SQL).
* Work experience in a Software development team leveraging agile tools like Azure DevOps, Jira, Confluence, GitHub, GitHub Actions, Slack, etc.
* 5+ Years' experience with Enterprise data warehousing, ETL, and BI services.
* 3+ Years' experience in Cloud data and modern data management patterns supporting data warehousing and data lake architectures on Azure.
* Understanding and appreciation of modern data platforms and integration services.
* Understanding and appreciation for modern approaches and platforms for data quality, data governance, and cataloging services, CDC, append-only, streaming, incremental data acquisition, and data mart/fact-dimension design techniques.
* Proven ability to build and manage executive-level client relationships.
* Strong communicator with an evidence-based mindset to developing customer experience.
* Goal and results-focused, with a mindset of delivering customer value; with a focus on speed-to-value in all activities.
* Proactive self-starter who can thrive in flat organizations and ambiguous situations.


**Salary Range**



Pay ranges vary based on multiple factors including, without limitation, skill sets, education, responsibilities, experience, and geographical market. The pay range for this position reflects geographic based ranges for Washington state: $160,700 to $200,000 USD/annually. The salary/wage and job title for this opening will be based on the selected candidate's qualifications and experience and may be outside this range.


**Equal Opportunity Employer**



Blueprint Technologies, LLC is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, orientation, veteran/military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital, or familial status, genetic information, citizenship, or any other status protected by law.



If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, please reach out to: recruiting@bpcs.com



Blueprint believe in the importance of a healthy and happy team, which is why our comprehensive benefits package includes:


* Medical, dental, and vision coverage
* Flexible Spending Account
* 401k program
* Competitive PTO offerings
* Parental Leave
* Opportunities for professional growth and development


**Location:** Remote

title: Regional Network Architect (Remote)
description:
**About AESC US LLC**

**AESC** is an exciting, newly created global organization committed to solving the challenges of a sustainable future and becoming the leading supplier of full-value-chain battery solutions. Our lithium-ion batteries can be found in more than Nine Hundred Thousand electric vehicles worldwide and have a stellar safety record of zero-critical issues. AESC US is leading the way in battery technology. We design and manufacture EV battery technology for various electric vehicles and equipment. We are working hard towards unlocking the full potential of sustainable energy and climate change mitigation. We will continue to build upon our successes and expand into new markets and industries, producing innovative and competitive products and technologies that advance the goal of a zero-carbon emission future. AESC is headquartered in Japan and has battery manufacturing locations in Japan, UK, China, and the U.S. We are currently seeking candidates to fill a **Regional** **Network Architect,**role to support our U.S. Based facilities. This is a wonderful opportunity for the right candidate to gain valuable experience and contribute to a growing company.

***This position is a remote position.***

**Job Summary**


As a seasoned Network Architect for our regional operations, you will serve as a linchpin in our global IT infrastructure COE, bringing your extensive experience to design, implement, and manage complex network systems. In this pivotal role, you will be the authority on creating robust, secure, and scalable network architectures, delivering Tier 3 support, and ensuring seamless integration with our global network practices. Your knowledge of manufacturing-specific network requirements, particularly in the automotive sector, will be vital in driving our network strategy forward. You will lead efforts to standardize and document network processes, fostering cross-regional coherence and upholding our commitment to excellence. Combining technical acumen with strategic oversight, you will enhance our network capabilities and provide the leadership needed to maintain our competitive edge in a dynamic, interconnected environment.

**Job Functions**

*The following job function statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of this* *position.*

 **Key Responsibilities:**

**Network Architecture and Design:**

* Develop comprehensive network designs that address both current and future organizational needs, considering factors like scalability, security, and redundancy. Manufacturing experience a PLUS.
* Lead the transformation and modernization of the regional network architecture to ensure alignment with global infrastructure and industry best practices.
* Collaborate with cybersecurity teams to ensure that network designs adhere to stringent security protocols and standards.

 **Tier 3 Support:**

* Provide hands-on technical expertise for the most complex network issues, ensuring minimal downtime and rapid resolution.
* Develop and maintain documentation on regional network issues, solutions, and configurations to ensure faster resolutions in the future.
* Collaborate with tier 1 and tier 2 support teams, offering guidance, and ensuring they are equipped with the necessary tools and knowledge.

 **Collaboration and Consultation:**

* Lead discussions with business units to understand their specific network needs and translate those into technical requirements.
* Work closely with vendors, evaluating and recommending network products and solutions that align with the company’s objectives.

 **Management and Leadership:**

* Oversee regional network projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Foster an environment of continuous learning, encouraging team members to stay updated with the latest in network technologies and methodologies.
* Conduct regular review meetings with internal teams to ensure alignment and address any challenges promptly.

 **Continuous Improvement:**

* Lead initiatives to optimize and upgrade the network infrastructure, ensuring the organization remains at the forefront of technology adoption.
* Regularly review and analyze network performance metrics, identifying areas of improvement and implementing solutions.

 **Documentation and Standardization Development:**

* Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for regional network architectures, configurations, standards, and procedures.
* Lead the creation of a centralized knowledge repository that is accessible to global teams, ensuring that documentation is up-to-date, accurate, and effectively structured.
* Champion the development and continuous refinement of network standards and best practices to be adopted across the organization.
* Facilitate cross-regional collaboration to ensure network design and documentation consistency, aiding in swift and precise issue resolution.
* Implement documentation version control and review processes to keep pace with network changes and updates.
* Coordinate with global IT teams to align regional documentation with global network strategies and ensure standardization across all platforms and projects.

 **Qualifications and Skills:**

* Documentation and Standardization Development:
* Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for regional network architectures, configurations, standards, and procedures.
* Lead the creation of a centralized knowledge repository that is accessible to global teams, ensuring that documentation is up-to-date, accurate, and effectively structured.
* Champion the development and continuous refinement of network standards and best practices to be adopted across the organization.
* Facilitate cross-regional collaboration to ensure network design and documentation consistency, aiding in swift and precise issue resolution.
* Implement documentation version control and review processes to keep pace with network changes and updates.
* Coordinate with global IT teams to align regional documentation with global network strategies and ensure standardization across all platforms and projects.
* Excellent project management skills.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.


"We participate in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S."

title: Network Security Architect Entry Level Opportunity
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing…**


From internships and co-ops to leadership development programs and entry-level roles, Verizon’s award-winning Campus program allows you to take the next step toward shaping your future. Our Campus program has been recognized with awards like WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs and RippleMatch’s Campus Forward Award. Why the accolades? It’s easy. We quickly immerse our early in career V Teamers in meaningful work that delivers tangible business impact. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to network with V Teamers across the globe, find mentors, and establish meaningful friendships that could last a lifetime. Start here and go anywhere, with opportunities across the business. When students like you join the V Team, our network becomes even stronger.


This position is for a Security Architect entry level role in the Verizon Global Network & Technology organization. In this role you will work to proactively engineer security controls to mitigate risk early in the development lifecycle. You will gather requirements, designs, codes, tests, implements, and support secure applications and solutions while maintaining knowledge of various programming languages, data analytics and automation tools. You will ensure scalability of emerging security technologies and solutions.


As a Security Architect you will:

* Analyze new networking solutions, identifying potential security concerns, recommending approaches that can be used to mitigate identified risks, and working with technology teams to implement recommendations.
* Implement security controls developed by the business to mitigate risk during the development lifecycle.
* Implement tools and programs developed by senior staff to improve the security analysis process within the business.
* Keep up to date on emerging security technologies and solutions.
* Provide client support, escalating consultation and information security subject matter expertise to senior members.
* Review provided requirements, design, code, test, implement, and support secure applications and solutions while maintaining knowledge of various programming languages, data analytics and automation tools.
* Work under supervision to implement security controls developed by the business to mitigate risk during the development lifecycle.


You must be currently enrolled in a degree program and be in good academic standing to be considered.


In this hybrid full time position, you’ll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager. This hybrid role will be based out of Cary, North Carolina.


 If you are interested in other roles and locations in addition to this one, please submit your application to those postings as well in order to be considered.

### **What we’re looking for...**


You’re a motivated self-starter. Never satisfied with the status quo, you’re always trying to perform at your personal best. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where new challenges come up every day. You are flexible, dependable, and work well in varying environments. Learning quickly is personally rewarding and inspires you to take smart risks.


You’ll need to have:

* Current enrollment in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree majoring in Telecommunications, Information Technology, Engineering, Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science or related majors with a completion date of June 2024.
* Coursework or experience with Threat modeling including Microsoft STRIDE and Mitre ATT&CK.
* Coursework or experience in Network & Security protocols (ex: TCP/IP).
* Coursework or experience in Cloud Infrastructure, Policies, & Standards, Security Configurations.
* Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship.
* Willingness to travel and work in Cary, North Carolina.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Demonstrated strong written and communication skills.
* Experience working with Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite.
* Ability to work with/in Cloud IAM, Authentication, and access control.
* Ability to work with/in Cloud Computing (AWS/Openshift/GCP/Azure).
* Ability to work with/in Network Performance.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every "even better" qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

title: Network Architect (DoD)
description:
Based in Washington D.C. Metro area, Pivot Path Solutions, LLC is a government contracting and management consulting firm that offers enterprise IT solutions, strategic planning, organizational development, and business transformation services to help customers adapt and thrive in changing market conditions. We bring passion, sincerity and integrity to every product and service we provide to our customers. Pivot Path Solutions is currently seeking a talented **Network Architect** to join our team. This is a remote position, however candidates are preferred based in Washington D.C. Metro area.  

  

**Project Description:**  

This initiative is designed to support the Information Technology mission of the Defense Health Agency (DHA). The program will deliver a range of services encompassing Cybersecurity, Information Systems Operations, Desktop Support, Mobile Technology Services, Infrastructure Services, Information Systems Development and Modernization, as well as Web Services Development, Management, and Support.  

  

**Key Roles/Responsibilities:*** **System Administration:**


	+ Provide system administration for all servers, network equipment, operating systems, and applications on the network.
	+ Ensure the stability and performance of the entire network infrastructure.
* **Vulnerability Mitigation:**


	+ Provide input and support for mitigating vulnerability findings from network security scans.
	+ Implement measures to enhance network security and resilience.
* **PKI/CAC Support and Maintenance:**


	+ Support and maintain DOD PKI/CAC requirements, including OCSP Software for authenticating PKI certificates.
	+ Manage PKI hardware and software, ensuring compliance with government regulations.
* **LAN and WAN Management:**


	+ Manage LAN and Wide Area Network (WAN) connectivity, guaranteeing Quality of Service (QoS) for various applications.
	+ Provide cost-effective solutions and recommendations for network optimization.
* **External Connectivity:**


	+ Ensure secure external connectivity through point-to-point links, Virtual Private Network (VPN) tunnels, remote access, and NIPRNet access.
	+ Take responsibility for the remote access VPN in alignment with authorized user requirements.
* **Daily Operations and Inspections:**


	+ Perform daily operations activities, including Syslog and Event log reviews, backup verification, and physical inspections of server rooms and equipment.
	+ Identify and report potential issues, mitigating risks with minimal impact on the production environment.
* **Monthly Maintenance:**


	+ Conduct pre-scheduled monthly maintenance on the DoD network environment.
	+ Notify network users in advance, ensuring minimal disruption during maintenance windows.

**Minimum Qualifications:*** Minimum of 6 years of experience in planning, designing, implementing and managing DoD networks
* Minimum of 6 years of experience in maintaining onsite network operations, applications and hardware
* DoD 8570 IAT Level 2 certification

**Desired Certifications:*** Security +
* CCNA, CCNP

**What We Offer:**


Pivot Path Solutions strives to attract, motivate, and retain the best people in the industry. Our benefits package reflects our continued commitment to our employees by prioritizing the health and well-being of each member. These benefits include:

* Medical Health Insurance
* Dental

This includes but not limited to; meeting the eligibility requirements for access to classified information and the ability to obtain a government-granted security clearance. Individuals may also be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment verification, education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.
