title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Position:** DevOps Engineer
  
  

**Hours of Work:**  

**Monday through Friday:** 8:30AM-5:00PM
  
Full-time, Exempt
  
To the extent permitted by law, the Company may, in its sole discretion, change the work schedule to address business needs. Work hours will depend on the business hours of the time zone serviced.
  
In This Role, You Will…
  
Be responsible for the cloud network architecture design and implementation as well as remediating findings from cloud network security, vulnerability scanning and penetration testing. You will work closely and collaborate frequently with distributed cross-functional teams while optimizing our platforms and tooling for speed, usability and reliability to meet the current and future needs of our customers and the business.
  
  

**Responsibilities and Essential Duties:**  

* Assist with ensuring the platform is PCI, OWASP, and ISO 27001 compliant.
* Assist with WAF/reverse proxy (NGINX) configuration and maintenance.
* Administer and maintain the Linux environment.
* Utilize Terraform IaC to provision machines.
* Work closely with development teams to deliver solutions that are reliable, flexible, scalable, and provide low-cost ownership.
* Own and be responsible for one or more pieces of our CI/CD pipeline(s).
* Author, update, and review technical documentation related to processes and specifications.
* Maintain and administer WordPress.
* May perform additional functions depending on market demand and staffing in order to provide consistent quality customer service.


**Required Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study (i.e. Computer Science or Engineering). Relevant experience may be substituted for each year of required education.
* Minimum of three (3) years of experience in DevOps or relevant experience in IT and SysOps.
* Minimum of two (2) years of production experience configuring and implementing AWS network resources & strategies.
* Possess some experience with EKS, ECR, and IAM.
* Minimum of two (2) years direct experience building and maintaining CI/CD tooling, Jenkins pipelines & GitHub.
* Direct experience in creating and extending Continuous Integration (CI)/Continuous Delivery (CD) environments via Terraform or CloudFormation as well as container experience.
* Minimum of three (3) years of demonstrable experience with a scripting or Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) language & bash or Python scripting.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience working in a distributed version control environment (Git / Subversion (SVN)) with demonstrable experience using branch management and rollback strategies.
* Experience using Golang to develop back-end components to build optimized, scalable and modular software for cloud and networking services.
* Experience with network security protocols and WAF technologies.
* Excellent interpersonal skills necessary to communicate effectively with vendors, service dealers, customers, and all levels of company staff.
* Self-motivated to learn and asks the right questions to ensure goal achievement is met.
* Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; ability to multitask, change direction, effectively prioritize, and meet deadlines with limited direction from management.
* Ability to pay close attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy and possess strong and effective organizational skills.


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* AWS Solution Architect or Practitioner
* Experience with Docker
* Experience as SQL/NoSQL admin
* Experience with WordPress administration


**Physical Demands:**  

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit for extended periods; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to twenty (20) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.

title: Senior Cloud Network Engineer and Architect
description:
**Work Responsibilities:*** Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) to perform all aspects of cloud network architect, security controls in agency’s Azure subscriptions
* Play a key role in ensuring the reliability, security, and performance of network segments and all virtual components in agency’s Azure cloud environments
* Perform cross-functional teams to deploy and manage cloud services, automate tasks, and optimize agency’s cloud infrastructure for efficiency and scalability
* Collaborate with software architects and other stakeholders to design and implement Azure cloud infrastructure solutions that meet the organization's needs, including virtual networks, secure connections and interfaces between on-premise and cloud network
* Efficiently provision, configure, and manage Azure network resources and protocols to support the organization's applications and workloads
* Ensure proper resource allocation and utilization. Develop and maintain automation scripts and templates (e.g., ARM templates, PowerShell) to streamline the deployment and management of Azure network resources
* Implement and enforce security best practices, including identity and access management, network security, and encryption (where needed).
* Continuously optimize Azure infrastructure for cost-effectiveness and performance wherever possible.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, provide technical guidance, and document Azure architecture and configurations.
* Troubleshoot and resolve Azure’s network related issues and incidents, providing timely and effective solutions.
* Design and implement scalable and highly available solutions using Azure services and features, such as Azure Load Balancers, Availability Sets, and Azure App Service Environments.
* Recommend system enhancements and expansion to IT Operation management.
* Support the full lifecycle of cloud computing management, from customer needs analysis and environment assessment, through design, test, migration, and operation.
* Meet the scope, deadline, budget and client expectations of the cloud project
* Subject Matter Expert (SME) to manage, maintain and administer virtual network components an resources. Be able to install, test and verify upgrades, perform hardware life cycle refresh
* Thorough knowledge of computer network telecommunications, Windows Server operating systems, virtualization in a VMWare environment, and the TCP/IP protocol and TCP ports in Secure Cloud Platform
* Thorough knowledge of telecommunications, network, and computer security principles and protocols. Be able to determine related issues and established security practices
* Be able to lead approved LAN/WAN technology deployments and network expansions and upgrades to ensure documented procedures and policies are followed
* Recommend equipment, parts and software required to be purchased by the Government in support of the System Improvement Plan

  

**Requirements:*** At least six years of experience in a large organization responsible for administering, operating, maintaining, and securing a large-scale computer network, including two years in a technical leadership or supervisory role.
* At least five years of experience in supporting a complex secure cloud infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and PaaS environment covering all aspects of cloud administration
* At least four years of progressive experience in supporting a large network comprising Internet based gateway-to-gateway VPNs, MPLS and point-to-point WAN products
* At least five years of hands-on experience in business requirements gathering, architecting and designing an on-premise or Cloud base solution based on Network and security principles
* Hands-on experience with Azure Vault, IAM, Secret Manager, built DevOps pipelines, and write Code
* Understand the client’s automation goals to support the development of software solutions to meet or exceed those goals
* Thorough knowledge of network management protocols and related standard tools.
* Advanced knowledge of load balancing technologies and implementation with F5 BigIP appliances. Additionally, must have thorough knowledge of F5s SSLO, APM, SWG, LTM, GTM, AVR, AAM, and iRule LX

**What We Offer:*** Competitive salary plus bonus-earning potential
* Health, dental, and vision benefits
* 401K saving plan with company match
* Remote work environment

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**  

Emerging Tech, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to providing a workplace that is inclusive and free of employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This commitment extends to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, transfer, compensation, benefits, training, social, and recreational activities.  

We value diversity and strive to create a positive and inclusive work environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect. Decisions regarding employment are made based on an individual's qualifications as they relate to the job for which they are applying.

title: API Architect
description:
EV Connect is seeking an experienced, hands-on API Architect with 8+ years of design, prototyping and implementation experience. If you share our passion for electric mobility ecosystems, the environment and energy independence for future generations, please read on.  

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior API Architect to lead the charge in defining our next generation API-first architecture. This person will play a crucial role in creating and maintaining secured, scalable, highly responsive and robust API suites hosted in our cloud native environments. **As an API Architect, you'll contribute to the following activities:*** Work closely with Products on business use cases by providing technical expertise and supporting documentation.
* Own all aspects of our Integration Architecture (IA). Evaluate emerging technologies.
* Establish and document the full life cycle of API governance standards and best practices.
* Drive towards industry standards and RESTful services and identify appropriate integration approaches.
* Work with internal and external API consumers and service providers. Drive towards optimal integration agreements.
* Document the API landscape, identifying gaps and participate in roadmaps definition.
* Continuously monitor and improve API performance and utilization. Predict scaling needs and manage scaling operations effectively.
* Manage API gateways. Design and enforce API policies.
* Supervise partner facing API documentation as well as internal API documentation.
* Ensure designs and initiatives are in line with the overall corporate vision, strategies and goals.
* Train and mentor others on REST APIs, microservices, API Gateways, containers, and automation.

 **Required skills and experience:*** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* 8+ years of experience in API architecture and development, specifically with REST frameworks
* Experience in OAuth2, OIDC, TLS, mTLS, OpenAPI, Swagger, SAML, PKI and Digital Certificates
* Solid understanding of microservice architecture and containerization technologies
* Good knowledge of Integration/API life cycle & Methodology, API standards and style guides
* Strong Background in REST based API development
* Strong software engineering and SAAS background
* Strong knowledge in core AWS services like API Gateway, S3, EC2, EKS, Lambda, SNS, SQS, Cognito, DynamoDB or equivalence in Azure
* Solid experience with Spring Boot, Java JavaScript, React, React Native, WebSockets, MongoDB Atlas, ELK stack.
* Experience operating in an Agile delivery model.
* Experience with cloud-native applications and an understanding of design principles for scalability, performance, and reliability.
* Good understanding of event driven architectures
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and a performance-oriented mindset
* Should have excellent communication skills. Be a fast learner and proactive thinker.
* Ability to innovate, automate, and continually improve processes. Possess critical thinking and analytical skills.

 **Would be a plus:*** Electric Utility experience
* EV charging industry experience.
* Familiar with EV charging protocols like OCPP and OCPI
* Experience with ELK stack.
* Experience with New Relic and Grafana
* Software Development Kit (SDK) building experience

 **About EV Connect****:**
EV Connect is on a mission to build a better planet by enabling electricity as a transportation fuel. Through its innovative and open charging platform, EV Connect simplifies the set-up, management, and optimization of charging stations with premium customer service, from installation to driver support. EV Connect guides companies of all sizes in managing networks of chargers and delivers a seamless EV charging experience that empowers drivers.  

Established in 2010, EV Connect is a subsidiary of Schneider Electric which serves customers across the U.S., including GM, Avista Utilities, Love’s Travel Stops, Verizon, Marriott, Hilton, Western Digital, SCE, New York Power Authority, and numerous municipalities. Globally, EV Connect's reach extends across Europe, Australia, and Asia, removing carbon emissions from vehicles through the electrification of transportation.  

Named to the 2022 Times100 List of Most Influential Companies, the Company has been a perennial member of the Inc. 5000 growth list since 2020. For more information, please visit www.evconnect.com and follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn.  

EV Connect is an Equal Opportunity Employer and requires proof of eligibility to work in the U.S.

title: Sr. Solution Architect
description:
**Who We Are**
Insurity’s vision is all about empowerment. Empowering insurance organizations to quickly capitalize on new opportunities by delivering the world’s most configurable, cloud-native, easy-to-use, and intuitively analytical software. It’s also about empowering our team members through tools, training, teamwork, and professional development opportunities.

To talk the talk, we must walk the walk. We are the largest cloud-based insurance software provider for the Property & Casualty market, and we are trusted by 22 of the top 25 Property & Casualty insurance carriers and 7 of the top 10 MGAs in the U.S. today. That’s proof we walk the walk. While our product suites are some of the most compelling in the industry, it’s our team members who deliver the exceptional value and unrivaled industry expertise our customers appreciate from us.

Our team tells us over and over; working at Insurity offers you the opportunity to collaborate with and learn from some of the most creative and knowledgeable minds in insurance technology. You’ll feel welcomed even before you start your first day with us through our award-winning onboarding program.

Take the first step to joining our team by applying today and we look forward to seeing **#UatInsurity**.
**Insurity’s Next Senior Solution Architect**
The Senior Solution Architect is a trusted adviser and subject matter expert leading our client work, bringing both deep understanding of the business of insurance and the analytics that can drive success for our customers. In this role you will act as a translation layer between business and analytic modeling teams, and work with technical implementation teams to execute the approach. You will be responsible for presenting results to various levels of leadership and influence key decisions that have customer or enterprise impact. The Senior Solution Architect is an industry thought leader, understanding current industry issues and trends to leverage opportunities to bring advanced analytics solutions to our customers that will achieve their strategic goals.
**What Our Senior Solution Architect Will Do*** Partner with carriers to function as a trusted advisor, by understanding their business and developing a roadmap to leverage analytics opportunities to achieve our client’s strategic goals through a long-term engagement plan
* Develop long-term trusted relationships with executive / key client stakeholders
* Collaborate with the data science team to develop advanced predictive models and exploratory data analyses that will unveil key data insights
* Identify, drive, and lead solution-based initiatives supporting customers
* Be a key communicator of analytical results and insights to various collaborators across the company and customer base
* Support responsibility for the integration of data science, data engineering, and solution architect in support and execution of client strategic engagements

**Who We’re Looking For*** Professional experience in the property and casualty insurance industry
* Ability to work effectively with executive partners
* Customer advocacy and passion to educate and deliver value through analytics
* Expert ability to translate complex analyses and concepts to non-technical audiences within and outside of the organization
* Strong verbal communication skills across diverse set of roles including executives, managers, underwriters, actuaries, data scientists, IT, and Insurity team members
* Excellent written communication skills demonstrating the ability to create succinct, compelling audience-relevant documentation
* Key Abilities / Traits:
* Strong multi-tasking capabilities and ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
* Ability to collaborate and work autonomously
* Flexible and adaptable
* Relevant degree

**What’s In It For U*** **Flex First Workforce**: Do your work best from home or from one of our office locations; it’s your choice.
* **Generous Time Off**: Our leadership believes in taking the time you need when you need it through our Open PTO Policy.
* **Day One Health Benefits + Employer-Matched Retirement Savings**: You might think these are table stakes, but we know these matter to you.
* **More Than Just Core Values**: Our values are fundamental in how we attract, train, and retain top talent.
* **Award-Winning Onboarding Program**: We set you up from the get-go to make a significant impact from Day One and follow you through your entire first year.
* **Real Career Growth Opportunities**: We love to promote from within with over 20% of our open roles filled through internal applicants on average.
* **Mentorship Program:** We support a champion culture and growth mindset by pairing you with experienced, talented leaders to help you grow personally and professionally.
* **Internal Networking:** Build relationships, network, collaborate, and stay connected with colleagues internally with our one-of-a kind online *Coffee for Two* program.
* **Continuous Learning Opportunities**: Own your development with your own LinkedIn Learning and Kaplan licenses.
* **Discounted University Tuition**: Employees and their families can start or continue their university career with less out-of-pocket investment through our partnerships with the University of Arizona Global Campus.
* **Employee Referral Bonus**: Once you come onboard, give Insurity the biggest compliment you can give by referring someone to work here and earn a cash bonus.



We have five Core Values at Insurity; one of which is to ***Act with Integrity***. Providing pay transparency helps you make the best decision for you. We continuously analyze and update our salary ranges for our roles according to market trends to not only ensure our employees are paid fairly, but also help close gender, race, and disability wage gaps. Along with the benefits listed above, the salary range for this role is $86,000 - $165,000, commensurate with experience.
**Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer**
We are dedicated to creating an exceptional work environment for all our employees by extending a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging into the very fabric of our organization. We embrace differences and diversity of identity, experience, and thought, and actively strive for inclusive behaviors across our company.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application and/or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Thank you for your interest in Insurity! Please understand that due to the volume of applicants we receive, only selected candidates will be contacted.
**#LI-Remote**

title: AWS Architect
description:
Job Title: **AWS Architect**


Location: **Remote**


Job Type: **C2H /** **Full-time**

  

  

**Job Description:**

  

  

**Position Summary**

  

  

The AWS Architect is responsible for the architecture, design, build, and maintenance of cloud and on premise infrastructure; supporting production and development projects across ACORD & ASG. As an AWS Architect, you will help architect, design, develop, integrate, and maintain infrastructure required for client core systems. This process includes optimization, monitoring, patching/maintenance, troubleshooting and supporting the end-to-end release process within our infrastructure and deployment pipeline.


**Position Responsibilities**

* Creates and enforces policies required for data management standards, physical and logical security, disaster recovery, data systems accessibility, and maintenance.

**Education & Essential Skills**

  

  

* BS in computer sciences or equivalent preferred.


* 10+ years of total experience with preferably around 3+ on AWS.

* Programming skills using Boto3.


* Good understanding of AWS CLI.

* Certifications on Amazon Web Services are a plus.

* Minimum of five years with Linux and Windows Server experience


* Ten+ years of total experience.

title: Network Operations Center Specialist
description:
Embark on a journey where professionalism and a laid-back work environment join forces as our newest Network Operations Center Specialist!

Frontline Managed Services® stands as a pioneer in IT, Financial, and Administrative Managed Services for legal and professional service firms. Our dedication to innovation, technology, and efficiency sets us apart in the industry. Our team is expanding and we are looking for new team members who are energetic, charismatic, and self-driven. We are seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our dynamic team as a Network Operations Center (NOC) Specialist. As a key player in our continental and global NOC teams, you'll contribute to the seamless operation of our clients' extensive networks, ensuring peak performance and security.

**Position Overview:**

As an NOC Specialist, you will be the escalation point of contact for client queries, providing second-level service through our ServiceNow platform. Joining our 24x7 infrastructure surveillance team, you'll play a crucial role in ensuring maximum service availability and performance for our Managed Infrastructure Services. Your responsibilities will include network provisioning, troubleshooting, and collaborating across various departments.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Network Monitoring and Maintenance:**Utilize advanced monitoring platforms (e.g., SolarWinds, LogicMonitor) to monitor and maintain large-scale networks.

Implement firmware and Windows patching to enhance network security and performance.

* **Security and Configuration:**Architect and configure MPLS, SD-WAN, client VPN, and site-to-site VPN solutions.

Manage and optimize Azure cloud platform services.

* **Collaboration and Troubleshooting:**Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve network issues promptly.

Utilize ServiceNow for incident tracking, resolution, and documentation.

* **Documentation and Knowledge Base:**Contribute actively to the client knowledge base, documenting processes and procedures.

Provide technical expertise in Cisco and Fortinet technologies.

* **Strategic Contributions:**Contribute to the development and execution of network strategies.

Participate in 24x7 shifts and support call-out rota if required.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* **Certifications:**Cisco CCNA and Fortinet NSE4 certifications are required.
* **Technical Proficiency:**Proficiency in Nimble and VNXe SAN technologies.

Proven experience with Azure cloud platform services.  
Familiarity with monitoring platforms (SolarWinds, LogicMonitor).

* **Networking Expertise:**Hands-on experience with firmware and Windows patching.

Proficiency in architecting and configuring MPLS, SD-WAN, client VPN, and site-to-site VPN.  
Knowledge of network topologies, standards, and infrastructure.

* **Communication and Collaboration:**Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Previous experience in a NOC environment, monitoring and troubleshooting various network services.

* **Team Skills:**Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

Commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Life insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Engineering, Content Delivery
description:
Remote, United States
Netflix Open Connect is one of the largest Content Delivery Networks in the world that delivers double digit percentage share of internet traffic. We are responsible for providing hundreds of millions of Netflix subscribers with the highest quality viewing experience possible. In addition to streaming video, we work on projects within Netflix that leverage physical infrastructure, such as our Cloud Games initiative.  

We are looking for a Director to lead the engineering team responsible for development of our content delivery system, which handles delivery of our VOD content, live streams, ads, and static assets. Additionally, the team is responsible for our Smart DNS service and contributes to development of our Cloud Games infrastructure. The content delivery system is composed of application layer code that runs on tens of thousands of Open Connect Appliances and control plane services that run in our AWS Cloud.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Lead architecture and development of the Open Connect CDN system
* Help us enhance and scale our live streaming capabilities
* Continue improving our system to be more efficient, reliable, secure, and manageable
* Refine our approach to running multiple CDN services on shared infrastructure
* Create incremental business value by helping identify, evaluate, architect, and implement additional ways to leverage our edge servers
* Nurture and expand a high performance, healthy engineering organization
* Drive and contribute to collaborative projects across engineering and other functions
**Requirements**
----------------

* Experience leading teams responsible for architecture and development of large scale, highly efficient, reliable, and manageable content delivery systems
* Experience building systems that provide low latency delivery of large scale live events
* Thorough technical understanding of internet architecture, video streaming, and related topics
* High comfort with technical complexity and ambiguity, and an interest to pioneer
* Exceptional communication, cross-discipline collaboration, and leadership skills
* Passion for excellence and getting things done
**Things that show what we work on and how we think**
-----------------------------------------------------

* FreeBSD optimization used by Netflix to serve 800 Gb/s from a single server
* Distributing Content to Open Connect

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and strive to build balanced teams from all walks of life.  

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $310,000 - $1,870,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.  

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

title: Network Architect
description:
Hi,

Greetings from Zllius Inc!

We have an urgent opening for the role**Network Architect.** If interested, revert me back with your Updated resume, along with contact details, work authorization.

**Job Role: Network Architect**

**Location: Harrisburg area (Hybrid)**

**Duration: Long-term**

**Position: W2/1099**

**Visa: Any (Except H1B)**

**Job Ref: AUG80**

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Design and develop network architectures for on premise datacenters, cloud (public and private)
* Prepare and deliver training, documentation and network awareness activities to the Network Engineering and Operations teams
* Develop technical solutions to help mitigate observed gaps in current connectivity solutions and hardware platforms
* Align to widely accepted networking standards and frameworks with overall business and technology strategy
* Adapt networking architecture elements to adapt to new standards as they emerge
* Identify design gaps in existing and proposed networking architectures and recommend changes or enhancements
* Possess a firm understanding of the interconnectivity within and to VMware, Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the Microsoft Azure platforms
* Be a strong technologist with pragmatic view and creative mind, and a natural collaborator with line of business architects, engineers, developers, application owners, service providers, and senior management

**Qualifications Network A**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
* In Lieu of undergraduate degree, the ratio is 1:1 meaning one year of work experience equals one year of college experience
* 7+ years of increasing responsibility architecting, positioning and delivering complex network engineering and architecture solutions. This includes but is not limited to multi-datacenter interconnectivity, WAN solutions based on carrier MPLS along with Internet-based DMVPN via all manner of Internet connection types
* Familiarity with public and private cloud connectivity technologies.
* Proven experience in design and operation of diverse enterprise networks

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Deep understanding of BGP routing within the context of carrier connectivity as well as internal systems connectivity along with redistribution techniques into and from other routing technologies like EIGRP.
* Experience with large wide area networks of 1000+ sites and migrations to Cisco SD-WAN from traditional connectivity types
* Strong hands-on technical abilities and attention to detail
* Deep understanding of Network design in various environments (LAN, WAN, Datacenter, Cloud)
* Demonstrated ability to assume independent and team-based responsibilities
* Strong teamwork, interpersonal and customer service skills a must
* Proven ability to lead and mentor others
* Strong communication skills a must; ability to read, write, and speak in a professional manner
* Excellent analytical and problem solving skills are essential
* Must possess a personal sense of urgency
* Ability to effectively multi-task and adapt to changing business priorities
* An understanding of firewall concepts (traditional and NextGen) and load balancing concepts a plus

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA and other federal, state, and local standards
* Sedentary work that involves sitting or remaining stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.
* Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer, utilizing a mouse, keyboard, and monitor

**Thanks & Regards:**

**Zllius Inc.**

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Lead Network Architect – VF
description:

**Rate:** $70 – $75  

**Employment Type:** Temp to Hire Resource, W2  

**Duration:** 9/11/23 – 3/11/24  

**Location:** Hybrid position with 2 days on site (Tuesday and Wednesday) at either Columbus, OH or Merrillville, IN

  

**Scope of Services:**


The IT Network Services team has responsibility for the voice, data, and telecommunication services for the enterprise. As the Lead Network Architect reporting to the Manager of Network Projects, you will work closely with the Architecture, Security, Infrastructure, and the Application Development team to provide overall architectural leadership for Security across the company.

  

**Roles, Responsibilities and Deliverables:**


As the Lead Network Architect, you will provide architecture leadership for the current and future company technology environment within the network domain. This includes working with business leaders and service providers to develop and implement network architecture strategies, as well as developing methodologies and processes to ensure compliance to those strategies.  

  

Your responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:


* Research technology industry and market trends for a domain
* Identify opportunities to invest in emerging technologies.
* Collaborate closely with peer Architects and IT staff to drive company objectives.

* Establish best practices and standards and track adoption of standards.
Provide network architecture consulting as needed on all major initiatives as assigned.  
*

Preferred Qualifications

* Experience with SDN and SDWAN deployment
* Knowledge of SCADA networks
* CISCO certifications

Experience applying ITIL.  
*

title: DevSecOps System Architect (Remote)
description:
**Spiral Solutions and Technologies, Inc. (Spiral)** is seeking a DevSecOps System Architect to join its team!  
**Location: Remote Locations**

The DevSecOps System Architect will assist the Program Manager with guiding the team's system and software development efforts towards successful project delivery in accordance with the System and Software Development Life Cycle (DSLC), Agile with Lean Kanban methodology and will work collaborative in a Development, Security, and Operations (DevSecOps) Agile environment.

This position is contingent upon Data for Decisions (D4D) contract award.

Requirements:

* Comply with all Policies and Procedures, project plans, and industry standards, to include Spiral Solutions, Federal, State, local, DoD, and co-contractors.
* Assist the Program Manager with guiding the team’s system and software development efforts towards successful project delivery in accordance with the System and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Agile with Lean Kanban methodology. All products will be delivered with accuracy, meeting or exceeding customer requirements, and either on time or ahead of schedule.
* Participation in Agile Team activities is mandatory. These activities include Daily Stand-up, Sprints, Regular reviews and retrospectives, and design meetings.
* Create and maintain high standards of system and software quality by creating software product and process documentation for all deliverables. This includes the preparation of system and software design specifications, installation documents, and system architecture information, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments, clear code, reports, and manuals, which ensures the most mature deliverables.
* Creates and maintains written and verbal procedures; prepares written technical documentation, training material, standards, reports, and other documents as assigned or requested by the Program Manager.
* Work closely with the Program Manager to ensure all external taskings or customer requests are vetted, documented via requirements process, and incorporated into the applicable project plan.
* Collaborate with teammates with maintaining, upgrading and potentially migrating legacy web applications and platforms to current technologies and cloud platforms.
* Ensures applications of system analysis techniques and procedures to include consulting with senior staff to determine hardware, software, and/or system functional specifications.
* Ensures stability, interoperability, portability, security, and/or scalability of the Military Lending Act (MLA), Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (SCRA), and Joint Duty Assignment Information System (JDAMIS) web applications.
* Communicates with senior staff to quantify specific current and future system requirements.
* Identifies DMDC systems data, hardware, or software components required to modernize system architecture.
* Perform proof of concept to evaluate new and emerging technologies, design patterns, and proposed solutions.
* Evaluates current or emerging technologies against cost, portability, compatibility, or usability.
* Provides general networking, computer, and other technology training and support as needed.
* Prepares and maintains a variety of records and reports related to assigned activities; provide special reports as requested by the Program Manager.
* Collaborate with DMDC staff, stakeholders, and other customers when directed by management, U.S. Government officials and co-contractors to design and implement features.
* Attention to detail is essential and all tasks must be carried out to the highest standard.
* Incorporate continuous education to improve skill sets and to integrate new emerging technologies in all projects. This includes studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques and computing equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks and participate in professional organizations.
* Provide technical leadership and support to further develop new hires and current software engineers by providing advice, coaching, and participate in Peer learning.
* Identify and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team and for Spiral Solutions.
* Participate in peer-reviews of solution designs and related code and provide constructive feedback.
* Assess opportunities for application and process improvement and prepare documentation of rationale to share with team members and other affected parties.
* Provide operation support as needed or when requested by the Program Manager

**Education and Experience:**N/A

title: Virtualization Engineer/Architect
description:
**SUMMARY**

DIGIT is seeking a Virtualization Engineer/Architect to support GSA platform management services which encompass operations, continuity services, and recovery services for all IT core infrastructure services required to deliver any technology. In support of platform management, the Virtualization Engineer/Architect support services including, but not limited to, managed hosting and unmanaged hosting (Platform-as-a-Service/Infrastructure-as-a-Service (PaaS/IaaS)), server installation, O/S loading, system hardening in accordance with Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) security requirements, installation of patches, application and system back-ups, and restoration.

As a leading provider of advanced information technology solutions and professional services to U.S. federal government agencies, is the prime for a $807m task order in support of the General Services Administration (GSA) Office of Digital Infrastructure Technologies (IDT) DIGIT (Digital Innovation for GSA Infrastructure Technologies) task order driving digital transformation and delivering continuous improvement and business value to its customers. The team is comprised of the best-in-class technology partners to leverage forward-leaning technologies and best practices to transform GSA’s IT capabilities and shift offerings to provide a more flexible service delivery model, completing the agency’s shift to a fully digital experience along with its adoption of advanced, emerging technologies such as intelligent automation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

This position shall perform the following (to include but not limited to) activities:

* Responsible for the implementation and management of virtualization products and systems that support virtualization, including all server hardware, networking, and operating systems including Microsoft and Linux.
* Simultaneously convert and support existing and future Hyper-Converged Infrastructure (HCI) architecture.
* Manage and maintain legacy HCI while providing technical expertise to migrate workloads from on-premises to cloud architecture.
* Leads technical direction, guidance, and assistance to assigned projects, suggesting efficient approaches and methods for solving problems Provides technical leadership for the integration or requirements, design and technology.
* Manages and ensures the technical integrity of the system baseline over time, continually updating it as various changes are imposed on the system during the lifecycle from development through deployment and operations and maintenance.
* In conjunction with system stakeholders, plans the verification efforts of new and unproven designs early in the development lifecycle to ensure compliance to established requirements.
* Prepares and presents written and oral reports.
* Analyzes diagnoses, and recommends solutions to complex systems problems.
* Develops advanced concepts of automation and information processing, display, control, and transfer for various subsystems.
* Ultimately responsible for the technical integrity of work performed and deliverables associated with the Systems Engineering area of responsibility.
* Escalate issues to vendor and third-party entities, as necessary and directed by the Government.
* Develops technical best practices, concepts, and technologies to present innovative computing solutions.
* Performs knowledge transfers to customers and looking for additional opportunities to help improve their environment.
* Works within engineering teams and engages with experts across all technology competencies: applications, data management, IT & business management, and network & infrastructure competencies.
* Support software upgrades, system troubleshooting, and fulfillment of access and applicable change requests.
* Provision and manage administrative accounts including creation, modification, deletion, and general identity access administration in accordance with GSA security policies and procedures.
* Deploy critical patches in accordance with agreed upon schedules.
* Work is performed under the general direction of a senior level manager.

title: Senior Data Center Network Engineer/Architect
description:
**Senior Data Center Networking Engineer/Architect**


**About:**


At M247, we believe that a well-designed and well-built infrastructure makes for a strong foundation. It is this belief that drives us to continuously research and discover new products and solutions and refine our process and methods so we can continually serve our customers.


Our mission is to empower businesses with seamless, reliable, and secure IT solutions. We strive to create innovative and customized networking services that cater to the unique needs of our customers across healthcare, financial, energy, and retail sectors. Our passionate commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction drives us to shape the future of IT, enabling organizations to thrive and grow in an increasingly connected world.




We are currently accepting resumes from competent people for our team of Senior Data Center Engineers.


**Overview:**


M247 is seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Center Networking Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. The successful candidate will have extensive experience designing, implementing, and managing data center networks.


**Responsibilities:**

* Designing, building, and maintaining the data center networks
* Installing and configuring networking equipment and related systems
* Managing and troubleshooting data center network issues
* Conduct network assessments and audits
* Participate in the planning and implementation of data center upgrades and expansions
* Create and maintain network documentation
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver network solutions


**Personality Traits:**

* Extremely performance driven
* Ability to work independently
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of accuracy
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment

**Qualifications:**

* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* CCNP Data Center certification or higher
* Minimum10 years of experience in the following Data Center technologies:
* ACI planning and managing complex migrations of infra to the fabric, and implementing remote ACI extensions
* SDA planning and managing complex migration of entire sites to SDA
* DR planning and testing across local and regional DC’s
* SD-WAN planning and managing of SD-WAN implementation
* Network Virtualization and Automation – NFV, SDN, DNA, ISE, Ansible, Puppet, Chef or other automation tools
* Storage Networking – SAN, NAS, FC, FCoE, iSCSI, MDS
* Strong knowledge of networking protocols:
* TCP/IP and IPv4/IPv6
* BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, and IS-IS (Routing Protocols)
* VxLAN, OTV, and LISP (Overlay Networking)
* STP, RSTP, and MSTP
* EtherChannel and LACP
* Network performance tool implementation – Netscout, ExtraHop, Gigamon.


**Requirements:**

* Must pass a thorough background check and 12-panel drug test
* Ability to lift and move heavy equipment
* Travel requirement up to 25%
* US citizens or green card holders only
* 1099 or C2C only
* No agencies or recruiting firms

  

**Compensation:**

* Hourly rate range $85 – $115
* Travel expenses reimbursed per client travel policy

  



  

This is a remote position.

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
**Job Description**  

The Senior Cloud Architect is an individual contributor role responsible for the design, architecture, engineering, and standardization of all cloud infrastructure environments including storage, computer, networking, virtualization, automation systems, and all associated hardware and software solutions. The Senior Cloud Architect is also responsible for setting the strategic direction of cloud services spanning infrastructure, platform, and software as a service; ensuring standard designs and implementation processes are followed consistently throughout the organization. The goal at MasterBrand is to digitally transform core business capabilities; shedding outdated on-premises platforms for newer generation cloud services and to adopt a “cloud-first” approach to existing and emerging capabilities of the business.

**This is a remote-based position. Selected candidate must be able to conduct business during the Eastern or Central time zones. Preferred locations are in the Cleveland, OH / Deerfield, IL / or Jasper, IN areas.**

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop standards and processes for the design, standardization, engineering, implementation, and maximization of cloud services used across MasterBrand.
* Partner closely with cloud partners to understand changing technologies, designs, and landscapes to roadmap changes and ensure proper fit with company objectives and technology dependencies.
* Form strong partnerships with MasterBrand digital technology and business peers to understand requirements and, problems to solve, and to align with overall business strategies.
* Ensure that security and risk management is embedded in all cloud service designs, engineering solutions, and implementations to ensure adequate protection of digital assets and data used to operate MasterBrand’s business.
* Consistently seek opportunities to scale cloud solutions to maximize effectiveness and efficiency both from a performance and cost perspective.
* Operate as a subject matter expert, designer, engineer, implementer, and consultant to any initiatives related to cloud services used across the enterprise.
* Communicate clearly and concisely with a professional demeanor to all levels of the organization

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s Degree in MIS or Computer Science preferred, or relevant concentration, with a minimum of five (5) years of experience; or a minimum (7) seven years relevant and equivalent business or IT experience.
* Minimum of three (3) years of Azure service management including integration, identity, security, storage, virtualization, compute, messaging, and networking within the Azure platform.
* Minimum of three (3) years of traditional compute, application, identity, and network experience (e.g., traditional data center, recommend and implement security hardening technical controls)
* Preferably have one or more of the following certifications: CISSP, Azure AZ-104, AZ-500, or above,
* Strong understanding of security concepts including SIEM, EDR, Network, Cloud, and Data security technologies.
* Experience in leading technical aspects of project work, integrating between IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS, and consulting adjacent teams on best approaches to cloud adoption.
* Experience in migrating from traditional on-premise technologies to cloud platforms is required.
* Strong analytical, documentation and communication skills.

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Ability to motivate, lead, and positively influence team members
* A thoughtful leader with a collaborative leadership style, can-do attitude, and innovative mindset
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interact and build trust across all levels of the organization
* Ability to work in a complex matrix organization structure which include holding company and owned subsidiaries
* Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Strong leadership and change management skills
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Strong communication skills – verbal, listening, written & presentation

**Culture:**

* Demonstrates trust in the process of lean methodologies and tools. Approaches situations through a fact-based lens. Analyzes data, draws conclusions, make recommendations, and present findings. Critically assesses and simplifies processes and controls, and challenge business drivers and risks.
* Embraces the team through strong interpersonal skills and the ability to relate to people at all levels of the organization, including diverse viewpoints. Seeks to understand and involves others in problem-solving. Proven track record of building a team and managing change.
* Moves forward through strong organizational and execution skills. Able to champion core issues, develop resourceful and creative solutions and drive results at all levels of the organization. Strong attention to detail and follow-through skills are a must. Ability to drive successful execution of strategic plans. Adaptable and flexible to changing business conditions and priorities.

  

**Additional Information**  

For nearly 70 years, MasterBrand has been shaping the places where people come together, enriching lives and creating meaningful memories for our customers. That, combined with our stylish products, expansive dealer and retail network, and dedicated associates, has helped make us the number one North American residential cabinet business. Our unique culture of continuous improvement is based on trusting the tools, empowering the team and moving forward, and is kept alive by our more than 14,000 associates across 20 plus manufacturing facility and offices. Visit www.masterbrand.com to learn more and join us in building great experiences together!

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


MasterBrand Cabinets LLC is an equal opportunity employer. MasterBrand Cabinets LLC’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability/handicap status, marital status, military status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. MasterBrand Cabinets LLC also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also MasterBrand Cabinets LLC’s policy to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws respecting consideration of unemployment status in making hiring decisions.

**Reasonable Accommodations**


MasterBrand Cabinets LLC is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you have a disability and wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment, please contact us at staffing@masterbrand.com.

* Actual pay will vary based on qualifications and other factors

title: Systems Architect
description:
Job Description:

We're hiring a Systems Architect to implement a standardized, aligned, synchronized Enterprise Architecture (EA) framework linking business, transformation and modernization, data, applications, technology, support and security across the organization. You will oversee enterprise architecture design and integrate new technologies, ensure security, set standards, and enhance ROI while aligning with business needs. In this role you will develop high-level design of enterprise application systems, identify detailed system architectures and dependencies, and define essential design features and elements to include cloud, network, security, data integrations, on-premises server and storage components while emphasizing total cost of ownership and return on investment associated with the solution. You will work with systems users in the identification and resolution of user problems and concerns for complex projects. **Typical Responsibilities include:*** Responsible for developing and maintaining Enterprise Architecture documents and frameworks ensuring it is strategically aligned with our customer organizational goals and objectives.
* Work with business stakeholders to align business goals and develop and maintain a technology roadmap to address technology growth, ensure cost reduction, standardization, decreased complexity, reduced risk, and business continuity.
* Continually integrate new technologies into the existing infrastructure to enhance capabilities and efficiency.
* Maintain security compliance, standards within the technology operations, safeguarding our systems and data cost reduction.
* Ability to work in complex environment while reducing the cost and optimizing resources.
* Deliver Business Value to enhance Return on Investment (ROI).
* Analyze, recommend, develop and deploy configuration changes to existing solutions to ensure standardization, decrease cost, complexity and/or risk and increases security and business continuity
* Recommend, engineer, and deploy new solutions to ensure standardization, decrease cost, complexity and/or risk and increases security and business continuity
* Engineer and deploy new solutions as required for new infrastructure or business requirements and needs


Qualifications:
* Master’s degree with 4 years’ experience or B.A or B.S with at least 6 years specialized experience in related technology.
* Familiarity with the latest technology trends like complex networks, cloud technologies, cross-platform integration, and large-scale projects.
* Familiarity with common Enterprise Architecture frameworks such as TOGAF (The Open Group Architecture Framework), FEAF (Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework), DoDAF (Department of Defense Architecture Framework).
* Experience designing and implementing complex systems.
* Strong knowledge of security best practices and compliance requirements.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Executive leadership presentation skills and experience.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams.
* IRS Experience required


About Us:

* Invest in your future – 401(k) Plan – Immediately vested employer contributions; no matching required

* Be part of a dynamic and collaborative work environment recently ranked by The Washington Post as a Top Work Place in 2019, 2020, & 2022!
* Have fun and celebrate and give back – Team building activities, community volunteering, quarterly HQ days, & an offsite annual awards banquet

**ABOUT US**
NetImpact Strategies Inc. (NetImpact) has been a Trusted Advisor driving impact through digital transformation for the Federal Government for over a decade. We solve complex problems with innovation and agility to create meaningful, transformative, and enduring change. As Trusted Advisors, NetImpact professionals partner with customer agencies to deliver solutions that empower them to not only meet their missions but also realize their strategic vision through agile, outcome-focused solutions addressing both strategic and tactical requirements. We design and implement comprehensive, tailored solutions that are both mindful of the client's culture and organizational dynamics. NetImpact’s core values and commitment to a customer and results-oriented delivery approach has propelled our growth and enabled us to deliver impactful value across Strategic Consulting, Process Automation, Cloud, DevSecOps, Data and Analytics, and Cyber Security for the Federal Government. **ACCESSIBILITY NOTE**

If you are an applicant and need reasonable accommodation when applying for job opportunities within NetImpact, or request reasonable accommodation to utilize NetImpact’s online employment application, please contact careers@netimpactstrategies.com. **EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**

title: Classified Transport Network Domain Architect
description:
**Description**


Leidos currently has an opening on the Navy ‘Service Management, Integration and Transport’ (SMIT) Contract for a Classified Transport Network Domain Architect. This is an exciting opportunity to use your experience and leadership skills to successfully execute the mission of the Navy’s largest IT services program: SMIT. Under the SMIT Contract, the Leidos team will deliver the core backbone of the Navy-Marine Corps Intranet, including cybersecurity services, network operations, network engineering, service desk, and data transport. Ultimately, Leidos will support the Navy in unifying its shore-based networks and data management to improve capability and service while also saving significant dollars by focusing efforts under one enterprise network. This position requires Architecture, Engineering, Operations Support, Management and extensive knowledge of network communications, architecture, security controls, compliance, and configuration discipline.


Qualified candidates will demonstrate professionalism and the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced and mission-focused environment. This position is highly focused on a Navy Classified Transport Network environment that requires a rich skillset in IP Networking, MPLS, SD-WAN, Type 1 Network Encryption, Cloud Networking, and other related technologies. **This position requires qualified individuals already possessing an active US DoD SECRET security clearance.**


Primary Responsibilities

**The Classified Transport Network Domain Architect is responsible for:**

* Applying Transport Network Subject Matter Expertise (SME) and thought leadership to the execution of the Navy’s classified network mission.
* Demonstrating knowledge and application of DoD and Navy network policies and directives.
* Collaborating with team to conduct trade studies/analyses of alternatives that support classified network architecture concepts for software and hardware, including designing, developing, and analyzing products and capabilities.
* Collaborating with Navy PEO-Digital Infrastructure Services APM-E, Service Owners, APM-E, Lead Engineers, and other DoD organizations (i.e. NNWC, US CYBERCOM), DISA, Industry Cloud Providers, and Partners to continuously improve the Navy’s classified network and its security posture.
* Identifying Transport Networking technologies and solution roadmaps to improve mission enterprise capabilities resulting in increased contract growth and improved customer experience.
* Participating in the Leidos SMIT Engineering Review Board
* Collaborating with other Domain Architects in cases of capability overlap areas, communicating, and collaborating with the Team.
* Proposal Support
* Providing subject matter expertise into new business for:
	+ Help with defining customer requirements through collaboration to ensure all requirements are being captured in proposals.
	+ Providing Level of Effort on system engineering and architecture tasks
	+ Providing information about required equipment for network related solutions
	+ Reviewing and providing information for proposal documentation
	+ Developing and/or Reviewing statements of work
* Architecture
* Collaborate with teams to develop Network Transformation approaches.
	+ Research and present technologies related to improving user experience.
* Provide subject matter expertise for analysis of alternatives, business case analyses, etc…
* Engineering
* Provide guidance and oversight to the Engineering Team:
	+ Provide guidance on integration of engineered systems into the existing environment.
	+ Provide system function information to Assessment and Authorization for system accreditation.
		- Package Diagrams, SEISA/A&A Plan,
	+ Resolve technical conflicts for system integration.
	+ Provide Lab guidance for minimal viable products to ensure proper testing of systems and system interfaces.
* Modeling Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) support:
* Provide subject matter expertise of the NMCI Unclassified/Classified network system and subsystem functions:
	+ Provide information about network related systems to cameo system modelers.
		- Provide/Review/Verify System Requirements
		- Provide/Review/Verify HLD Structure
		- Provide/Review/Verify LLD
	+ Develop and refine standardization and definition for systems being integrated into the Cameo System Modeler.
	+ Review and provide network system descriptions, background, and context.
* Operations
	+ Provide subject matter expertise of the Unclassified/Classified Network to assist in:
		- Tier 3 escalation point for network troubleshooting.
		- Making network decisions that are outside of the configuration baseline to resolve network issues.
		- Informing the Operations community about updates to current systems so they are aware of new functions associated with changes.
		- Provide briefings related to system changes to the Operational community.


Basic Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree preferred in STEM or relevant field, or comparable experience with an additional 12 years or a Master’s degree with 10 years of overall related experience.
* Exceptional written and oral communications and ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical managers and customers.
* Current IAT DOD 8570.01 IAT Level II Certification (defined as having one of the following): Comp TIA Security+ CE, Cisco CCNA Security, or ISC2 Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP).
* **Cisco CCNP Certification**
* Expert knowledge of network architecture, security boundaries/technologies, cloud networking (Azure preferred) and encryption technologies (Government Type 1 and Commercial Solutions for Classified)
* In-depth understanding of TCP/IP networking, ports, protocols, and the OSI model.
* Experience presenting to client stakeholders and company management.
* Ability to travel up to 10% including the potential for OCONUS travel.
* Although the position is remote, it will require ability of candidate to travel locally to a Navy NMCI facility to access the Navy’s classified Network. Location vicinities include:


Washington, DC


Norfolk, VA


Bremerton, WA  

Jacksonville, FL  

San Diego, CA  

Crane, IN  

Philadelphia, PA  

Pensacola, FL  

New Orleans, LA  

Great Lakes, IL  

Millington, TN  

Ft. Worth, TX


Preferred Qualifications

* Applicable Domain-Specific, Expert-level Technology certification such as CCIE, JNCIE, etc…
* Recent experience with Navy IT services and/or NMCI/OneNet
* Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) and SysML experience; Cameo Systems Modeler
* 15-20+ years of IT experience in multiple technical disciplines within DoD environment
* DevOps experience
* Microsoft Azure Cloud experience
* ITIL or Agile certifications
* Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level III certification highly desired

title: Coherent Optical Solutions Systems Architect
description:
Non-CA Pay Range (Annual):
$105,700.00 - $196,300.00
At Infinera, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. Your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. This role may be eligible for equity grants, discretionary bonuses, or commission payments. The amount of these incentives is based on the terms of the Company’s incentive plans, the Company’s financial performance, and/or individual employee job performance.
Infinera also offers paid leave, medical,
dental, and vision coverage, 401(k), life, and disability insurance and to
eligible employees.*Infinera is the global supplier of innovative networking solutions. Our customers include the leading service providers, data center operators, internet content providers (ICPs), cable operators, enterprises, and government agencies worldwide, including 9 of the top 10 Tier 1 service providers and 6 of the top 7 ICPs. We design, develop and deliver hardware and software for fiber-based connectivity solutions that span access, aggregation, metro, long haul, and submarine network. Our industry-leading, trendsetting edge-to-core solutions provide the foundation for many of the world’s largest and most demanding networks, generating billions in service revenue for our customers.*
Title: Coherent Optical Systems Architect
Reports to: CTO
Based at: US/Canada  

Job Description:
As a coherent optical systems architect, you will work with the CTO of the Optical Modules and Coherent Solutions Business Unit at Infinera to define the next generation of our digital coherent pluggable modules and high-speed component business’. The engineer will work on numerical and analytical modelling of the performance of next generation technologies, with a clear focus on solution sets that meet our end customer requirements. You will work closely with the core engineering groups that are response for the design and development of Infinera’s next-generation coherent photonic integrated circuits (PICs), analog drive ASICs and Flex Coherent DSP ASICs. Sophisticated simulation platforms guide major design decisions and serve as invaluable feedback to cross-functional design teams and end customers throughout the entire development cycle of Infinera’s next generation optical engines.  

Key responsibilities and accountabilities:* Develop simulation platform to analyze early concepts of next generation coherent pluggable products and sub-components.
* Engage and collaborate with core subsystem simulation and modelling teams.
* Through frequent interaction with the relevant design teams, you will assist in design, finding relationships between low level hardware specifications and its system level impact and optimizing performance-critical aspects to maximize overall modem performance.
* Work with the subsystems solutions architects and PLMs to refine and evolve the definition and performance of next generation products.
* Presented results at internal technical forums.
* Present results to end customers.
* Provide simulation and back-office support to our standards team, in order to support the standardization of next generation MSA compliant optical engines.
  

Specific Job Skills:* Fundamental understanding of optical communication systems, DWDM transmission systems, fiber transmission penalties, photonic integrated components, electronic (integrated) circuits, and signal analysis and processing.
* Experience and a strong mathematical understanding of the analytical and numerical modelling of system-level optical communication systems and components.
* Extensive understanding of coherent communications systems, including experience with QPSK, 16QAM, and 64QAM, as well as coding and forward error correction algorithms.
* Experience characterizing high-speed RF and mm-wave interconnects, amplifiers, and components such as S parameter, jitter, ENOB, nonlinear compression and their system implications.
* Experience in the characterization and modeling of various linear and nonlinear signal impairments, e.g., filtering, noise, nonlinear amplitude and phase distortions, dispersion etc.
* Programming experience in Matlab, Python, VB.net, or C desired.
  

Education and Experience:* PhD. in Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics or related discipline.
